description: To the Editor:

title: THE SEVEN WHO PERISHED IN THE EXPLOSION OF THE CHALLENGER
description: Michael J. Smith Comdr. Michael J. Smith of the Navy, an astronaut since 1980, was pilot of the Challenger shuttle mission.

title: HOSPITAL OWNER SAYS MANES SOUGHT TO GET JOB FOR HIS OWN WIFE
description: An owner of a new, private psychiatric hospital in Queens said yesterday that Queens Borough President Donald R. Manes promoted his wife, Marlene, for a top position in the hospital while the hospital was seeking city and state approval.

title: Help in Suit Defense
description: Doug West, the freshman basketball player at Villanova who told a Kentucky newspaper that a University of Pittsburgh trustee had offered him $10,000 to attend Pitt, has received some help from the National Collegiate Athletic Association in defending himself against a defamation action filed by the trustee. The N.C.A.A. gave tentative permission for Villanova to provide a lawyer for West.

title: REAGAN POSTPONES STATE OF UNION SPEECH
description: President Reagan, saying ''today is a day for mourning and remembering,'' postponed the State of the Union speech he had planned for tonight because of the space shuttle explosion.

title: BRUSH WELLMAN INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $9,784,000 for the quarter and $10,025,000 for the year. c-After a loss of $67,000 from discontinued operations for the quarter and including a gain of $307,000 from discontinued operations for the year. d-Net income.

title: COST OF INSURANCE IN SPACE MAY RISE
description: The explosion of the space shuttle Challenger could have the effect of raising premiums on insurance that is already expensive and difficult to obtain for commercial satellites carried into space, specialists in the field said yesterday.

title: The Irish Accord Holds
description: Last week's election in Northern Ireland failed to scuttle the new British-Irish accord to seek a progressive resolution of the province's communal strife. It gave diehard Protestants the photo opportunity they craved - a chance to wave placards insisting that ''Ulster Says No!'' That was the intent of the 15 Unionist members of Britain's Parliament whose resignations forced the vote. The re-election of all but one only confirmed the reflexive parochialism of a community still trapped in the religious wars of the Reformation.

title: THE SEVEN WHO PERISHED IN THE EXPLOSION OF THE CHALLENGER
description: Christa McAuliffe Christa McAuliffe, a high-school social studies teacher from New Hampshire, was the winner of a nationwide competition to be the first private citizen to fly aboard a space shuttle. She was 37 years old.

title: Smithsonian Planning $10 Million Divestment
description: The Smithsonian Institution said today that it would sell its $10.6 million in holdings in international investment companies to meet criticism that the companies may have investments in South Africa.

title: Ryan to Coach Eagles
description: Buddy Ryan, the Chicago Bears' defensive coordinator, will leave the Super Bowl champions to take the head coaching job with the Philadelphia Eagles, a source said today.

title: HOW COULD IT HAPPEN? FUEL TANK LEAK FEARED
description: Debris from the explosion of the shuttle Challenger was scattered so widely over the Atlantic Ocean that investigators may never recover enough of it to pin down the cause of the disaster. But suspicions quickly focused on the craft's huge external fuel tank, a potential bomb that carried more than 385,000 gallons of liquid hydrogen and more than 140,000 gallons of liquid oxygen at liftoff.

title: Schering-Plough
description: The Schering-Plough Corporation said its board had authorized the repurchase of up to $300 million worth of the company's common stock on the open market from time to time, depending on market conditions.

title: ACTING QUEENS CHIEF REGAREDE AS A MEDIATOR
description: During fractious Board of Estimate meetings, when positions have hardened and dialogue has ceased, Claire Shulman is known by her colleagues for breaking tension with a smile and then mending fences with a compromise.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST: WEDNESDAY, JANUARY 29, 1986
description: Companies

title: On Flight
description: As the Fox Movietone News rolls, the screen shows a small boy carrying what is said to be the nation's first airmail letter to planeside and handing it to a leather-helmeted pilot. Sharp-eyed viewers with good memories may recognize the flyer, an unknown barnstormer of the 1920's, as Charles A. Lindbergh, later an international hero as conqueror of the Atlantic.

title: PAYOFFS IN PARKING CASE: ONE LAWYER'S VERSION
description: For Michael G. Dowd, the trouble began on a spring day in 1982 at Tutto Bene, a popular restaurant for lawyers and politicians near the Queens courthouse.

title: EXXON NET RISES 26.6% IN QUARTER
description: The biggest company in the world, the Exxon Corporation, said yesterday that its net income rose nearly 27 percent in the fourth quarter but fell almost 12 percent for the year.

title: MCDONALD'S CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MISSILE SHIELD PROGRAM GETS PENTAGON'S HIGHEST PRIORITY
description: In his secret long-range directive to the military, Defense Secretary Caspar W. Weinberger, has declared that President Reagan's space-based missile defense program now shares the ''highest priority'' among Pentagon programs, equal in status to the five-year campaign to modernize nuclear missiles, Pentagon officials said today.

title: Slight Correction
description: Ever since he joined the Washington Bullets this season, basketball followers have frequently read of how Manute Bol, as a youth in the Sudan, was learning to dunk one day when he banged his head against the rim and broke two of his front teeth. The story isn't true.

title: Advertising; Promotions At Ammirati
description: Martin Puris, president of Ammirati & Puris, has stepped up to open the job for Edward H. Vick, 41 years old and an executive vice president and chief operating officer since he joined the agency in 1983.

title: IMPERIAL BANCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Hewlett-Packard
description: The president of the Hewlett-Packard Company, John Young, told analysts today that some Wall Street estimates that his company would earn $2.40 a share in the fiscal year 1986 were ''very optimistic.''

title: THE NETWORKS' COVERAGE OF THE SHUTTLE TRAGEDY
description: WITHIN minutes of the time television began reporting on the space shuttle tragedy yesterday, two questions dominated the coverage. The first, obviously, was, what happened? The second was, what did it mean? Speculation and reporting mingled. This wasn't necessarily improper or unfair; it was more that television, once again, was speeding up our thinking.

title: Togetherness on the Streets
description: The homeless are usually viewed as loners. But Dr. Leanne Rivlin, a professor of environmental psychology at the City University Graduate Center, said she had found they often banded together in groups of about a dozen - ''like a small family.''

title: PRESIDENT EXPRESSES HIS SORROW AT THE ASTRONAUTS' DEATHS
description: Following is the transcript of President Reagan's statement to the nation from the Oval Office yesterday afternoon on the shuttle explosion, as recorded by The New York Times:

title: TRANSPORTATION COMMISSIONER HAS BEEN DISMISSED, AIDES TO KOCH SAY
description: The City Commissioner whose department includes the scandal-plagued Parking Violations Bureau has been dismissed by Mayor Koch, top mayoral advisers said yesterday.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL ATLANTA (NL) - Signed Terry Harper and Brad Komminsk, outfielders.

title: YANKEES SAID TO HAVE REACHED AGREEMENT TO SIGN HOLLAND
description: The Yankees have reached an agreement in principle with Al Holland and are expected to announce the signing of the free-agent relief pitcher sometime this week, a club source said yesterday. But the Yankees failed in their effort to get a free-agent catcher, Darrell Porter.

title: JURORS IN A MURDER TRIAL VISIT THE SCENE OF CRIME
description: Jurors shivered in 15-degree cold this morning as they walked on snow past a stand of pines to the scene of the 1984 midnight murder of Maria Marshall.

title: WHAT PRECEDED THE INSTANT IN WHICH THE CHALLENGER WAS LOST
description: August 1984 President Reagan announces that to further the education of the nation's children, a teacher will be selected to ride into space. More than 11,000 teachers across the nation fill out the 11-page application for the honor. Among them is Sharon Christa

title: FLORIDA GOVERNOR OPENS SENATE BID
description: Gov. Bob Graham formally announced his candidacy today for the United States Senate.

title: Conrail Net Up 25.8%
description: Conrail has reported that its net earnings for the fourth quarter of 1985 rose 25.8 percent, to $112 million, or $4.06 a share, from $89 million, or $3.30 a share, a year earlier. The Government-owned railroad reported Monday that it had fourth-quarter revenue of $783 million, down 1.1 percent from $792 million a year earlier.

title: CULLUM COMPANIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31

description: ''There will be more shuttle flights and more shuttle crews and, yes, more volunteers, more civilians, more teachers in space.

title: U.S. STEEL NET LIFTED BY OIL UNIT
description: The United States Steel Corporation reported yesterday that its fourth-quarter earnings rose 96.6 percent, to $57 million, from $29 million a year earlier. Sales were virtually flat near $4.7 billion, and the company's basic steel operations showed a loss, so U.S. Steel got a big boost from its Marathon Oil Company subsidiary, analysts said.

description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of $151,000, or 9 cents a share, from a preferred stock dividend from the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp. Share earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split paid in December 1985.

title: AMID SOME UNEASE, BROOKLYN CHURCH PICKS A BLACK PASTOR
description: Members of the 163-year-old First Presbyterian Church in Brooklyn Heights talk about the appointment of a new pastor as a historic event, and some of them are a little nervous.

title: CONGRESSIONAL LEADERS TO HOLD EXTENSIVE HEARINGS INTO CAUSE
description: Committees in the Senate and the House today said they would hold extensive hearings into the space shuttle disaster, but that they would probably wait until after an internal investigation by the National Aeronautics and Space Administration.

description: The share earnings reflect 2-for-1 stock split paid December 2.

title: THE SEVEN WHO PERISHED IN THE EXPLOSION OF THE CHALLENGER
description: Francis R. Scobee Francis R. (Dick) Scobee, a veteran test pilot who served as pilot on a Challenger shuttle mission in 1984, was the commander of the Challenger.

description: b-Including a credit of $17,626,000 from an accounting adjustment.

title: TROUBLING QUESTIONS
description: The explosion of the space shuttle Challenger today will disrupt what space officials had proclaimed as ''the most important year since the space age began.'' It will also raise troubling questions about the long-term future of the manned space program, according to a variety of space analysts.

title: COMPUTER EXPERTS BAFFLED BY CRASH
description: Computer experts were baffled today about why none of the five I.B.M. on-board computers that have aborted so many space launchings detected anything wrong with the shuttle Challenger's operation until the instant the craft exploded.

title: STALEY CONTINENTAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss from discontinued operations of $7,581,000.

title: Sandoz Agreement
description: Sandoz A.G. said it had signed an agreement to buy the agri-chemical sector of the Velsicol Chemical Corporation, a subsidiary of Farley/Northwest Industries, for $200 million. The Sandoz Corporation is the United States subsidiary of the Swiss chemicals and pharmaceuticals group. Among other products, Velsicol's agri-chemical sector develops, produces and markets Banvel R, which Sandoz described as a leading herbicide.

title: Arco Suspends Buyback Plan
description: The Atlantic Richfield company announced today that it was temporarily suspending its $4 billion stock buyback program because of the plunge in crude oil prices.

title: Advertising; New Name And Brands At L.C.& F.
description: THE American Tobacco Company has consolidated all of its advertising at Laurence, Charles & Free, which meant ending a 40-year relationship with SSC&B.

title: BY SAVING THE LOBSTER LEFTOVERS, THE FEAST CAN BE PROLONGED
description: A DINNER of lobsters, splendid though it may be from the guests' point of view, often leaves a lingering sadness in the mind of the cook - particularly if he or she is an expert at picking a lobster clean. As the remains of the meal are carted out to the kitchen, a fair amount of perfectly usable lobster meat is often left behind in claws, legs, leg sockets and tail fins.

title: VARIAN ASSOCIATES reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 3
description: b-After a loss of $1.4 million from discontinued operations.

title: FROM ABROAD, MESSAGES OF SADNESS AND SUPPORT
description: Foreign leaders and officals reacted quickly yesterday to the explosion of the space Shuttle Challenger and the death of the seven people aboard, sending messages of condolence and support to Washington and in some cases pausing for a moment of mourning.

title: Manila-Japan Deal
description: The Philippines has signed an agreement with the Japanese Government to restructure $500 million of official debts under Paris Club rules, Prime Minister Cesar Virata said.

title: FOR THE FAMILIES, THE MOMENT OF DOOM
description: Bundled against the cold Florida morning, Ed and Grace Corrigan watched with pride and nervous excitement as the space shuttle Challenger, carrying their daughter, Christa McAuliffe, and six other astronauts, thundered off the launching pad here.

title: Ewing Is All-Star
description: Patrick Ewing of the Knicks and Buck Williams of the Nets were named yesterday to the East squad for the National Basketball Association All-Star Game Feb. 9 in Dallas. Ewing, who is averaging 21.2 points, is the only rookie on the team, coached by K. C. Jones of Boston.

ISLANDERS TROUNCE MAPLE LEAFS, 9-2
description: Denis Potvin added another historical puck to his collection, the line of Duane and Brent Sutter and Mikko Makela collected 14 points in its first outing, and the Islanders tied their season-high in goals as they beat the Toronto Maple Leafs, 9-2, tonight at Nassau Coliseum.

title: WESTPORT BANCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a gain of $588,000 from the sale of real estate.

title: FROM THE BEGINNING TO THE END
description: The last flight of the shuttle Challenger lasted 74 seconds. Here is the space agency's transcript of Challenger's final moments, before and after liftoff.

description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of $10,874,000 from an exchange of debentures and common stock for outstanding debentures. c-Net income, including a gain of $1,803,000.

title: Walter Salmon Jr., Horseman And a Real-Estate Executive
description: Walter J. Salmon Jr., a horse breeder and real-estate executive, died of kidney failure Saturday at his home in Roslyn Harbor, L.I. He was 78 years old and also had homes in Manhattan and in Lexington, Ky.

title: Pentagon and the Press: The War Goes On
description: When the Defense Department prevented the press from covering the first days of the invasion of Grenada in October 1983, editors erupted in anger, asserting that the people's right to know had been violated. Equally angry, military officers contended that the press could not be trusted to preserve security in the course of military operations.

title: CARTIER INC. PLEADS GUILTY IN SALES-TAX EVASION CASE
description: Cartier Inc. pleaded guilty yesterday to a felony charge of falsifying business records in a scheme to enable its customers to avoid paying sales taxes, city and state investigators said.

title: SPECIAL SENSE OF TRAGEDY AND LOSS IN SCHOOLS
description: Because Christa McAuliffe was one of them, tens of thousands of teachers gathered their students around television sets in classrooms across the country yesterday morning.

title: BORG-WARNER CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a non-recurring net charge of $56 million related to Agribusiness Loans made by the company's Acceptance Corporation and including a gain of $25 million on the sale of the company's stake in Echlin Inc.

title: O'SULLIVAN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
PERSONAL HARDSHIPINSPIRES DONATIONS FOR NEEDIEST CASES
description: Personal experiences of hardship often inspire people to contribute to the 74th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Don't Bribe the Taxi Monopolists
description: After years of retreat before New York taxi interests, Mayor Koch seems to be angling for a deal: He will bless a taxi fare increase if Stanley Friedman - the political boss of the Bronx, sometime city contractor and lobbyist for taxi owners - permits a 10 percent increase in the number of yellow cabs. The deal would probably avoid a fight but that is not enough reason for the riding public to pay such ransom.

title: HIGH-TECH TACTICS SLOW FILM PIRACY
description: Two summers ago, when Paramount Pictures distributed ''Indiana Jones and the Temple of Doom'' to 1,800 movie theaters, the company had concealed in the film a few extra images that, while not enhancing its suspense or special effects, did improve its profits.

description: The Shuttle Explosion

PHILIPPINE ELECTION: PROBLEMS MARCOS DIDN'T FORESEE
description: With presidential elections 10 days away, Filipino and foreign analysts agree that President Ferdinand E. Marcos has run into problems that were not foreseen when he called the election three months ago.

title: Beatrice Delays Board Meeting
description: The Beatrice Companies said today that it was rescheduling to Sunday a board meeting that had been scheduled for today. The Chicago-based food and consumer-products company, which had agreed to be acquired by Kohlberg, Kravis, Roberts & Company for $6.2 billion, said it was continuing to review its alternatives in light of the revised offer made by Kohlberg.

title: JUSTIN INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DANCE: LUCINDA CHILDS OFFERS WORLD PREMIERE
description: LIKE other dancer-choreographers in the Judson Dance Theater in the 1960's, Lucinda Childs turned away from conventional dance idioms, a proscenium stage, music and scenic concepts.

title: THE STAGE: TAVEL'S 'NOTORIOUS HARIK'
description: IN his last two plays, Ronald Tavel sidestepped away from the Ridiculous style of theater, of which he is a co-founder. With his new play, ''Notorious Harik Will Kill the Pope'' (at Theater for the New City), he returns to his roots, so to speak, with results that are quizzical. After three acts and three hours, one is still in the dark about the principal purpose of the evening.

title: DOCUMENTS ON MARCOS CITE COLLABORATION REPORTS
description: Evidence that family members of the candidates in the Philippine presidential campaign collaborated with the Japanese during World War II has emerged as a hotly contested issue in the final days of the race.

title: CONGRESSMAN HURT IN FALL:
description: Representative Jim Wright, House majority leader, with his left arm in a cast at a meeting at the White House. Mr. Wright broke his wrist Monday in a fall from a makeshift podium while giving a speech. He called the injury ''the first cut under Gramm-Rudman,'' referring to the new budget-balancing law. He is expected to wear the cast for four to six weeks. At rear is Robert H. Michel, House m

title: Australian Dollar Financings in U.S.
description: The flurry of Australian dollar financings in the United States capital market continued yesterday with new issues from J. P. Morgan & Company and the Commonwealth Bank of Australia.

title: SOUTHWEST AIRLINES CO reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
description: The company said results are consolidated with Muse Air as of June 30, 1985.

title: The Lugar Mission Requires Toughness
description: The greatest mistake that the official American team sent to monitor the Philippine elections could make would be to move too cautiously in its important mission of freedom. The 40-member delegation, led by Senator Richard G. Lugar at the suggestion of President Reagan, could make a crucial difference for the future of democracy in the Philippines.

title: JUDGE CLEARS WAY FOR RETRIAL OF EDWARDS ON FRAUD COUNTS
description: Federal District Judge Marcel Livaudais refused today to block a second trial of Gov. Edwin W. Edwards, his brother and three others on Federal racketeering and fraud charges.

title: REPORTER DEFENDED ON BERRY AGREEMENT
description: Vincent M. Doria, the assistant managing editor for sports at The Boston Globe, defended an agreement between a reporter and Raymond Berry, the coach of the New England Patriots, to delay publication of information regarding drug use by members of the team until after the season.

title: THE OPERA: 'CAPRICCIO' BY STRAUSS IN CONCERT
description: WHEN Richard Strauss set out to write ''Capriccio'' his intention was ''to do something unusual, a treatise on dramaturgy, a theatrical fugue.'' He succeeded in that strange plan, but he and his librettist, Clemens Krauss, went further and produced one of the most fascinating and sophisticated works in the entire opera repertory - that is, in so far as ''Capriccio'' can be said to be in the repertory. Rarely does even the most avid Straussian run across this elegant dramatization of the old debate about the relative importance of words, music and theatrical effects in opera.

title: ALAMITO CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Savoring the Slopes
description: Down the slope at Hunter Mountain they sped, tall white hats flapping in the wind and burgundy-hued aprons whipping around their legs. White hats? Aprons? Skis? It was the 11th annual chefs' ski race at the Catskills resort, with 250 competitors, including a score of well-known Manhattan chefs.

title: PERSONAL HEALTH
description: CIVILIZATION, as we know it in affluent Western cultures, has brought many medical benefits, including control over most once-fatal infectious diseases, and has created a few serious health problems, including coronary heart disease, lung cancer and high blood pressure.

title: P.L.O. NOT TOPIC, ISRAELI SAYS
description: An adviser to Prime Minister Shimon Peres of Israel said today that Europeans had not pressed Mr. Peres during his tour to negotiate with the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: Economic Scene; Confronting New Oil Fears
description: SUDDENLY, previous anxieties that the Organization of Petroleum Exporting Countries would keep pushing prices up through the roof, extorting hundreds of billions of dollars from oil consumers in the industrial world and less developed countries, have given way to fears that OPEC has lost control of the market or, alternatively, that OPEC's Arab members, led by Saudi Arabia, mean to break the power of non-OPEC producers by driving oil prices down to ruinous levels.

title: SOUTHERN NATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
Illinois Bond Offering Gets a Good Reception
description: A $100 million issue of Illinois general obligation bonds was well received yesterday, with all but about $10 million of the issue sold by late in the day, according to underwriters led by the First National Bank of Chicago.

title: Right After This Shark
description: After the 24th commercial I had seen enough. ''Now we'll watch 'Jaws,''' I said. This referred to a movie about a shark terrorizing an island that looks suspiciously like Martha's Vineyard.

title: MERCK & CO INC reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: Corrected from yesterday's editions.

title: A.T.&.T. OFF 1.6% IN FOURTH QUARTER
description: The American Telephone and Telegraph Company yesterday reported an earnings drop of 1.6 percent for the fourth quarter of 1985 on an 8.4 percent increase in revenues.

title: Marriott Notes To Yield 9.70%
description: The Marriott Corporation is offering $100 million of 9 5/8 percent notes due 1996 at a price of 99 1/2, to yield 9.70 percent, through underwriters led by the First Boston Corporation. The notes, rated Baa-1 by

title: RICHARD E. BERLIN, EX-LEADER OF THE HEARST CORPORATION, 92
description: Richard E. Berlin, who served as top manager of the Hearst Corporation for 32 years, died yesterday at his home in Rye, N.Y. He was 92 years old and had worked for Hearst for 54 years.

title: Joe Williams Quitting
description: The Florida State basketball coach, Joe Williams, announced yesterday his resignation effective at the end of the season. The 51-year-old Williams, whose team is struggling with a 7-10 record, is in his eighth year at the school. He has been a major-college head basketball coach for 22 seasons.

title: BLACK SOUTH AFRICAN YOUTHS END SCHOOL BOYCOTT
description: The South African authorities reported today that many of the nation's black high-school students, some of whom have been boycotting classes for almost two years, had returned to school.

title: THE POP LIFE
description: IN the wake of the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame's first annual induction ceremony late last week, three new albums by exceptional American popular singers have appeared. One is by Sam Cooke, a Hall of Fame inductee; the two others feature artists -Aaron Neville and Arthur Prysock -who have been criminally neglected and unrecorded, men whose contributions can be measured primarily in terms of their outstanding vocal musicianship.

title: AT MISSION CONTROL, SILENCE AND GRIEF FILL A DAY OF HORROR LONG DREADED
description: In the Mission Control room here today there was so little indication that anything was wrong with the shuttle that Stephen A. Nesbitt, the public affairs officer, routinely reported its position a minute and 15 seconds after launching as 7 nautical miles downrage. In fact, the craft had already exploded and was dropping into the Atlantic Ocean.

title: Guessing Right
description: Some Super Bowl postscripts:

title: UNITED ILLUMINATING CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SHE JUST SOUGHT TO HELP QUEENS, FERRARO ASSERTS
description: ''I was simply trying to help - no more or less,'' said Geraldine A. Ferraro yesterday in explaining why she offered to temporarily replace Borough President Donald R. Manes of Queens, who is under Federal investigation.

title: Q&A
description: Q.

title: Lincoln Borglum Dies; Aided at Mt. Rushmore
description: Lincoln Borglum, who spent 10 years helping his father etch Presidential portraits into Mount Rushmore in South Dakota, died Monday at a hospital in Corpus Christi. He was 73 years old.

title: PRESIDENT TO SEEK A 12.5% INCREASE IN FOREIGN AID
description: Despite the push to cut the Federal budget deficit, the Reagan Administration has asked Congress to increase foreign aid by 12.5 percent over the current fiscal year, to a total of $16.3 billion.

title: Record Brazil Inflation
description: Brazil's inflation rate rose to 16.2 percent in January, the worst monthly figure on record, pushing the annual cost-of-living increase to an unprecedented 237.3 percent, the Brazilian Institute of Geography and Statistics said. The January inflation rate, up from 13.36 percent in December, was principally attributed to rising food prices caused by a six-month drought in Brazil's agricultural heartland.

title: AMERICAN PRESIDENT COS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MERCURY SAVINGS & LOAN reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Including an extraordinary gain of $701,000 for the quarter and year.

title: Against Miranda
description: To the Editor:

title: MUSIC: CHAMBER SOCIETY
description: CHAMBER MUSIC SOCIETY OF LINCOLN CENTER concerts usually include all the right elements - gifted artists and a healthy sampling of familiar and unfamiliar material - but it sometimes seems as though nobody has taken the time to stir them together. Therefore, the society's Monday evening concert at Alice Tully Hall proved a distinct pleasure: The performances were carefully considered, well rehearsed and deftly executed, and all but one composition on the program was unfamiliar.

title: NETS TRIUMPH; KNICKS 118, BULLS 111
description: The goals are dwindling to a precious few. With the recent loss of Bill Cartwright, the chances of the Knicks attaining a winning season are almost nil. The playoffs are still a mathematical reality, but they, too, are quickly becoming a far-fetched hope. What remains is an opportunity for Hubie Brown, the head coach, to hone the talents of the young players he hopes will be playing for him in the future.

title: CUTBACKS IN COUNSELING SERVICES HURT POOR STUDENTS, REPORT SAYS
description: In an interim report made public today, a commission of the College Board said cutbacks in college counseling services in public schools had deprived inner-city students of the advice and support that students in wealthier, suburban school districts received.

title: IOWA STATE UPSETS KANSAS BY 77-74
description: Jeff Grayer scored 19 points tonight to lead Iowa State to a 77-74 upset of Kansas in a Big Eight game.

title: A CLASSIC DEVICE FOR SLICING FRUIT
description: FOR all the high-tech innovations in kitchen equipment in recent years, there are still some cleverly designed, old-fashioned tools that remain unsurpassed for certain chores. The Divisorex by Westmark, pictured here, is one of them. Made of polished aluminum with two large handles, it slices and cores apples, pears and other fruits into 12 even slices in seconds.

description: Debt

title: WINE TALK
description: Can one person taste a wine and then accurately describe the experience to someone else? Is the wider enjoyment of wine hampered because wine journalists cannot or do not convey the delights of taste and smell that combine to provide the unique pleasures of wine?

title: SUDDENLY, FLASH OF FEAR DASHES WATCHES' HOPES
description: As the Challenger rose skyward, about 350 guests at a viewing area on a hill about six miles from the launching pad cheered and clapped.

description: Mayor Koch stood off-camera in a television studio here today, pancake makeup still on his face, and declared victory for something that happened 3,000 miles away, back home.

The Death of a School Teacher
description: NASA's achievement was to make the space shuttle seem routine. It never really was. The complexity of the machinery and its massive computer program led to frequent launch delays. A serious mishap nearly marred a shuttle flight last July when the main engine failed and the craft barely reached orbit. Yesterday, the routine disintegrated into catastrophe.

title: EXPERIMENTS ON SPACE MISSIONS AIDED ADVANCE TO TECHNOLOGY
description: The space shuttle and the technology that spawned it are part of an expanding industry responsible for numerous existing and projected benefits worth billions of dollars in medicine, communications, food production, energy exploration and other fields.

description: Stefan F. Blaschke has joined Siegel & Gale as a senior vice president.

description: FOR decades the nondescript commercial buildings along Seventh Avenue and its side streets between Times Square and Pennsylvania Station served primarily as workrooms for the needle trades.

description: In a move with potentially serious economic implications for Libya, most of the Libyan subsidiaries of American oil companies operating here have temporarily suspended exports of their entitled allotment of oil, business executives and diplomats said today.

title: Market Place; Dividend Rise Candidates
description: STOCKHOLDERS tend to love dividend increases. But despite prospects for rising corporate profits in 1986, there probably will be fewer dividend increases than in 1985, a year when profits declined slightly. That's the forecast of Arnie Kaufman, editor of Standard & Poor's Outlook.

title: NORFOLK SOUTHERN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Paul N. Who?
description: After Postmaster General Paul N. Carlin was dismissed three weeks ago by the Board of Governors of the United States Postal Service, his name was nearly obliterated from the official agency account of the year he served. Mr. Carlin, who had been with the service since 1969, was ousted for unsatisfactory performance, notably his failure to streamline the agency's management structure.

description: b-Including a tax credit of $5,223,000, plus a gain of $5.3 million from the liquidation of Lifo inventories. c-Including a tax credit of $10.2 million.

title: Dow Climbs 18.81 Points, to 1,556.42
description: Helped by favorable interest rate developments, the stock market yesterday was able to extend its rally to a fourth consecutive session as share prices rose sharply in heavy trading.

description: b-Net losses.

title: BUILDERS OF SPACECRAFT STUNNED AND PERPLEXED
description: Engineers in the vast Rockwell International Corporation plant here searched for an explanation today for the explosion on a spacecraft that Rockwell had taken deep pride in building.

title: UNGARO'S BRIGHT PALETTE LIGHTS UP COUTURE
description: PARIS, Jan. 28 - Both Emanuel Ungaro and Karl Lagerfeld consolidated their strong positions in today's spring and summer couture showings.

title: SERGEANT IN HIT-RUN REPEATS HE WAS SOBER
description: In the final day of testimony in his manslaughter trial, Police Sgt. Frederick G. Sherman said that while he might have appeared drunk on the night of a fatal hit-and-run accident last year, he was actually sober.

title: Japan Imports 7.6% Less Oil
description: Japan's crude oil imports fell 7.6 percent in 1985, with declines mainly in supplies from the Middle East, according to the Ministry of International Trade and Industry.

title: DELUXE CHECK PRINTERS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CHEERS TURN TO NUMBNESS AS CONCORD HIGH SCHOOL MOURNS ONE OF ITS OWN
description: Scores of students at Concord High School were gathered in the auditorium this morning, wearing party hats and cheering and blowing into noisemakers as the space shuttle Challenger roared into the sky with a social studies teacher from the school aboard. They cheered more when they saw a flash.

title: TOLEDO EDISON CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
PLAYBOY ENTERPRISES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss from discontinued operations of $38,662,000 in the quarter, and a loss from discontinued operations of $39,012,000 in the six months. c-Net income, including in the quarter income from discontinued operations of $114,000 and an extraordinary gain of $1,804,000 and in the six months net from discontinued operations of $1,476,000 and an extraordinary gain of $2,759,000. d-Including a first quarter reclassification of a $350,000 charge from continuing operations to discontinued operations to conform to the current quarter presentation.

title: PANEL OF EXPERTS TO STUDY DANGERS OF TERRORISTS USING NUCLEAR ARMS
description: A panel of experts on nuclear weapons design, terrorism and intelligence matters will study the danger of terrorists' stealing a nuclear bomb or the material to make one.

title: Advertising; New York Telephone Introducing TV Spots
description: When the New York Telephone Company increased its pay phone charge from a dime to a quarter about two years ago, it expected to get about a 30 percent drop in use. And it did.

title: Bridge: Certain Esoteric Bids Hold Great Danger of Confusion
description: Some bids that have esoteric meanings should be avoided by average players since the danger of a misunderstanding must be considerable.

title: INFORMATION RESOURCES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results reflect the acquisition of Management Division Systems Inc. in May 1985, which was accounted for on a pooling of interests basis.

title: Ford Cancels Ad Campaign Linked to Shuttle Program
description: The Ford Motor Company canceled its national advertising campaign today that links its Aerostar minivan to the space shuttle.

title: STANDARD-PACIFIC CORP reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
description: Latest quarter and year figures reflect writedowns of $286,000 related to certain operations and $1,241,000 to revalue its inventory of improved lots in the Houston area as well as a gain of $803,000 on the sale of the company's Panel-Air Corp. subsidiary.

title: A Promise of Peace in Uganda
description: Uganda's capital had good reason to cheer the triumph of Yoweri Museveni and his insurgent army. At the least, the flight of government soldiers means a break in the military deadlock that left Kampala besieged for months and disrupted the simplest routines of daily life.

title: WESTERN SAVINGS & LOAN ASSOCIATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
FOUNDER OF CHURCH OF SCIENTOLOGY
description: L. Ron Hubbard, the founder of the Church of Scientology, died here Friday, and mystery surrounds his death just as it cloaked the final years of his life. He was 74 years old.

title: Digital VAX Line
description: The Digital Equipment Corporation yesterday introduced three new super-minicomputers in its VAX line.

title: INTERCHANGE STATE BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Fire Kills 51 Thoroughbreds
description: A fire fanned by high winds swept through a metal barn at a horse training center Tuesday, killing 51 thoroughbreds, many being trained for the spring meeting at Churchill Downs in Louisville, Ky. Joselito Millan, a physician who owns the training center, estimated the value of the dead horses at more than $1 million. Eleven horses were rescued from the fire in the red and white alumimun T-shaped barn.

title: Public Power Is a Money-Saver
description: To the Editor:

title: REBEL SWORN IN AS UGANDA PRESIDENT
description: Yoweri Museveni, whose National Resistance Army descended on this battered capital city last week and overthrew the military Government of Gen. Tito Okello, was sworn in today as the new President of Uganda.

title: PHILIP MORRIS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Results for the latest periods include results of General Foods Corp. from Nov. 1, when it was acquired. Net income for 1985 was increased by $38 million, or 32 cents a share, from the sale of industrial operations. c-After a charge of $146 million, or $1.19 a share, from the writedown of a completed but inactive Miller Brewing Co. facility.

title: Delayed Houston Bonds Are Sold; Demand Good
description: Houston, which earlier this year delayed a $100 million sewer bond financing because of worries that investors would be deterred by the provisions of the tax bill passed in December by the House of Representatives, yesterday sold the bonds through underwriters led by Prudential-Bache Securities Inc.

title: ST. JOHN'S WINS WITH LATE SURGE
description: For a week leading up to last night's game, Rollie Massimino, the Villanova coach, had fashioned an unusual strategy in an attempt to slow down the Redmen's Walter Berry.

title: CHARTING AQUINO'S COURSE: PORTRAIT OF THE INNER CIRCLE
description: When Corazon C. Aquino is faced with a difficult decision, according to people familiar with her style of leadership, she consults with an inner circle of trusted advisers that includes members of her family, which has been involved in politics for generations, and a small number of opposition politicians and activists.

title: Sexism and Psychiatry
description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: NEWS SUMMARY: THURSDAY, JANUARY 30, 1986
description: The Shuttle Inquiry Officials began a broad inquiry in an effort to determine the cause of the explosion of the shuttle Challenger, history's worst space disaster. Ships, planes and helicopters searching a 50-by-100-mile rectangle of the Atlantic Ocean recovered hundreds of pounds of debris that might hold clues to the accident Tuesday that killed seven astronauts. [ Page A1, Columns 3-6. ]

title: DU PONT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a non-recurring gain of $63 million from adjustment of a prior year's tax provision, a $31 million benefit from adoption of new FASB pension accounting standards, a $33 million benefit associated with revised actuarial assumptions. c-After non-recurring charges of $219 million related to business restructuring and the company early retirement program, and including non- recurring credits from litigation settlements, adjustment of a prior year tax provision and a reduction in after- tax pension costs after the adoption of a new FASB accounting standard totaling $209 million.

title: TEC INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income.

title: BETHLEHEM STEEL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of $19,200,000 from the early extinguishment of debt.

title: Double Exposure
description: Valerie Brisco-Hooks and Diane Dixon are matched again next week in the 400-meter run at the Vitalis/ U.S. Olympic Invitational, where the women's 400 last year created a two-week-long squabble.

title: IPALCO ENTERPRISES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
PHILLIPS PETROLEUM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss of $171 million from disposal of mineral operations, and after a downward adjustment of $71 million to reflect accounting changes. c-After a loss of $3 million from discontinued operations.

title: BRENCO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes income of $226,000 from discontinued operations in the prior year. Net losses for the latest quarter and year include a pre-tax writedown on equipment of $785,000 and a pre-tax writedown of inventories of $1,644,000.

title: DISPUTE ON POLICY ON JOBS CONTINUES
description: Attorney General Edwin Meese 3d and Labor Secretary Bill Brock failed in a meeting this week to resolve their differences over a proposed new policy on Federal contractors' hiring of women and members of minority groups, Reagan Administration officials said today.

title: FCP INC reports earnings for Year to Sept 30
3 Economists Criticize House Tax Legislation
description: The tax-overhaul plan passed by the House of Representatives would hurt the economy by requiring corporations to pay for a big tax cut for individuals, three economists told the Senate Finance Committee today.

title: FILM OF LAUNCHING SEIZED
description: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration has temporarily impounded film owned by news organizations that shows Tuesday's launching as part of an extensive effort to gather materials that may help determine why the space shuttle Challenger exploded, space agency officials said yesterday.

title: CANADA SUPPORTS AIR-INDIA REPORT
description: Canadian investigators have concluded that an Air-India plane that crashed into the Irish Sea in June with a loss of 329 lives was deliberately blown up.

title: OPENNESS IS KEY IN SOLACING YOUNG
description: Child health experts expressed concern yesterday about the psychological impact that the televised death of Christa McAuliffe will have on the nation's schoolchildren, who were primed to see a teacher's triumph in space but instead witnessed a mind-searing disaster.

title: DELTA CONSIDERS MOVES TO SIMPLIFY ITS FLEET
description: Delta Air Lines said yesterday that, in an attempt to strengthen its cash position and simplify its fleet, it intends to sell 13 of its refurbished McDonnell Douglas DC-8-71's and may choose not to exercise its options to buy 18 Boeing 767-300 airplanes.

title: FEDERAL-MOGUL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a net gain of $7,326,000, or 56 cents a share, for the quarter and year from the sale of facilities.

title: PANHANDLE EASTERN CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Civiletti Named Counsel In Rhode Island Inquiry
description: Benjamin R. Civiletti, who served as Attorney General under President Carter, was named Tuesday as counsel to the Rhode Island House of Representatives for its impeachment proceedings against Chief Justice Joseph A. Bevilacqua of the State Supreme Court. The Chief Justice is accused of having links to organized crime.

title: FLAMEMASTER CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a tax credit of $5,536.

title: ATLANTIC PERMANENT FEDRAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: NEW YORK'S WATER AND TRASH PROBLEMS
description: TWO of the less alluring municipal themes - too little water and too much trash -are handled with the proper degree of alarm, data and debate on tonight's edition of ''Metroline'' at 10 o'clock on WNET/Channel 13.

title: IN CONCORD, MCAULIFFE'S NEIGHBORS MOURN LOSS OF A 'SHING EXAMPLE'
description: Faith Hughes remembered the time last year when she and the other seniors at the Concord High School gave Christa McAuliffe a parachute, as a joke and a memento to mark her becoming a finalist in the Teacher in Space program.

title: RIBLET PRODUCTS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Zell Has Options In Allis-Chalmers
description: A partnership controlled by a Chicago real estate investor, Samuel Zell, said that it had acquired options to buy a 44.2 percent stake in the Allis-Chalmers Corporation. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, CA Ltd. said it had entered into option agreements to acquire about 1.5 million shares of preferred stock, raising its stake to about 4.9 million shares of a special preferred stock convertible into 12.8 million common shares.

title: Pennsylvania Attempts To Stop Flu in Chickens
description: More than 130,000 chickens were ordered destroyed Tuesday as state officials tried to control an outbreak of deadly avian flu.

title: New European Westland Bid
description: The European consortium battling for a stake in Britain's Westland helicopter company made a new offer today to win over small shareholders who might otherwise choose to accept a rival American-led bid.

title: JURY STARTS DELIBERATIONS IN TRIAL OF SERGEANT CHARGED IN HIT-RUN
description: A jury began deliberations last night in the trial of a New York City police sergeant accused of driving a patrol car that killed a pedestrian in a hit-and-run accident last March.

title: Keeping McGivern in Prison Benefits No One
description: To the Editor:

title: DIRECTORS GUILD LISTS NOMINEES FOR '85 AWARD
description: Ron Howard, John Huston, Sydney Pollack, Steven Spielberg and Peter Weir were nominated today by the Directors Guild of America for its 1985 award, an award that usually foreshadows the Academy Award competition. Only twice in the 37 years the guild has been honoring directors has the winner failed to collect an Oscar as best director also.

title: SONIC HUMIDIFIERS TRANSFORM THE MARKET
description: ULTRASONIC humidifiers, the newest machines to combat the dry air that comes with cold temperatures, are improving the humidifier market.

title: WITNESS IN BRIBERY TRIAL TELLS OF A TIP TO F.B.I. ABOUT JUDGE
description: A witness in the influence-peddling and perjury trial of a Federal district judge testified today that he tipped the Federal Bureau of Investigation to suspect under-the-table dealings involving the judge and a wealthy businessman.

title: VEECO INSTRUMENTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
COOPER INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including the results of McGraw- Edison Company which was acquired last April.

title: How Much Is Too Much?
description: Jimmy Jacobs and Bill Cayton, co-managers plotting the future of the knockout sensation Mike Tyson, raised an eyebrow or two the other day when they said they expected to have their man fight twice a month this year. That is 24 bouts, a busier 12-month docket than for any other legitimate prospect in recent memory. This for a 19-year-old who has already had 17 matches since turning pro last March.

title: Bank Fund Yields Up Slightly
description: The average yield for a bank money market account rose modestly in the week ended yesterday, while yields on six-month certificates of deposit and money market mutual funds lost ground.

title: ANGOLAN REBEL SEES TOP U.S. OFFICIALS
description: Jonas Savimbi, the Angolan rebel leader, opened a 10-day visit to the United States here today in search of support.

title: Kennedy Delays Soviet Trip
description: Senator Edward M. Kennedy has postponed a scheduled trip this week to the Soviet Union because of the space shuttle disaster, a spokesman said today. The trip, for a meeting with Mikhail S. Gorbachev, is to be rescheduled, probably next week.

title: Output Off By 1.8% In Quarter
description: Nonfarm productivity dropped at an annual rate of 1.8 percent in the last quarter of 1985, the sharpest decline in four years, the Government said today. The decrease when farming was included was 1.3 percent, the Labor Department said.

title: AMERICAN CAN CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a net gain of $3.9 million, or 16 cents a share, from the sale of certain timberlands, for the quarter and an unusual gain of $1.1 million for the year. The year gain reflects gains of $17.5 million, or 72 cents a share, from the sale of the company's remaining interest in James River Corporation, $12.4 million, or 50 cents a share, from the sale of Timberland and a provision of $28.8 million to writedown a preferred stock investment in new TC Holding Corporation, the parent of Ticor, a Los Angeles based insurance holding company. c-Including tax benefits relating to tax law changes for life insurance reserves of $10.9 million for the quarter and $13.5 million, or 60 cents a share, for the year, and from the combined effects of the divestiture of Canadian operations and Chemplex, the sale of timberlands and a provision to writedown the company's remaining investment in Mexico, a loss of $400,000 for the quarter and a gain of $4.4 million, or 19 cents a share, for the year. The year result includes also an extraordinary gain of $3.6 million, or 16 cents a share, from an exchange of the company's common stock for a portion of its debt.

title: VALLEY UTAH BANCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Barking in the Bronx
description: Q. What do a Bronx politician and a seal have in common? A. A name. Stanley the seal was named for Stanley Simon, the Borough President, yesterday by the North Wind Undersea Institute on City Island.

title: DU PONT UP 23.2% IN FINAL '85 PERIOD
description: E. I. du Pont de Nemours & Company, benefiting from a 57 percent increase in after-tax operating income from its energy businesses, yesterday reported a 23.2 percent increase in earnings on a 1.3 percent rise in revenues in the fourth quarter of 1985.

title: Apple Names Its Chairman
description: Apple Computer Inc. today named its president and chief executive, John Sculley, to the additional title of chairman.

title: TERMIFLEX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BRAE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss. c-Net income.

title: Walesa Refuses To Repudiate Remarks
description: The Solidarity founder Lech Walesa said in an interview published today that he stood by every word of the remarks for which he will stand trial on charges of slandering the state.

title: Fed Plans Cutbacks
description: The chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, Paul A. Volcker, told Congress today that the Fed would voluntarily cut back its administrative operations, including bank examinations, ''in a way that is consistent'' with the Gramm-Rudman-Hollings balanced-budget act.

title: Fund Is Set Up for Children Of the Shuttle's Passengers
description: A Washington lawyer has established a trust fund to receive contributions to benefit the children of the seven people killed in the explosion of the space shuttle Challenger, a bank official said today.

title: HOME REPAIR
description: IN many houses with basements or crawl spaces, floors sag or slope because the foundation has settled, wood support posts have rotted, or floor joists and beams have warped or rotted. This is especially true after extensive alterations, such as the removal or addition of load-bearing walls on the first floor or the addition of a second story.

title: U.S. ACCUSED OF ALTERING STUDY OF FOOD PROGRAM
description: Congressional leaders today accused the Department of Agriculture of deleting key sections of an extensive study of a national program for feeding pregnant women and children, in order to obscure the study's favorable conclusions.

title: GENERAL EMPLOYMENT ENERPRISES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income.

title: MAGNATE BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary item of $462,000, a Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp. preferred stock dividend.

title: Pennzoil Files Court Memo
description: The Pennzoil Company asked a Federal court in White Plains yesterday not to allow a group of seven Texaco shareholders to intervene in its legal battle to collect $10.53 billion plus interest from Texaco Inc. A group of seven Texaco retirees filed a motion with Federal District Judge Charles L. Brieant earlier this month.

title: A NEW PARIS MUSEUM, ONLY FOR FASHION
description: France finally has its own official fashion museum. It is in the Louvre complex, next to the Museum of Decorative Arts, in the Marsan Pavilion on the Rue de Rivoli, a 17th-century building that had been vacant for decades.

title: Technology; The New Field Of Biosensors
description: INSULIN injections are not the ideal solution for diabetics. Injections give a big burst of insulin rather than adjusting the levels based on how much sugar there is in the blood. Pumps have been developed that can be implanted in the body and dispense insulin gradually, but this still does not match the level of insulin to the need.

title: FROM SAINT LAURENT, SIMPLE ELEGANCE
description: Everything seems to peak at Yves Saint Laurent's shows: the crowds, the excitement, even the fashions. His heart seems to be in his couture collections, as he thinks through the impression he wants to make and leaves little to chance.

title: HERS
description: I'S a close-up on a huge spinning disk: lights flash, and the band's entire brass section blows its heart out as shades of the rainbow whirl around at dizzying speed, offering pie-shaped sections labeled from $150 to $5,000.

title: Dow, Mitsubishi
description: The Dow Chemical Company and Mitsubishi Chemical Industries agreed to form a joint venture to make and market urethane chemicals in Japan, the companies said. The value of the venture, MD Kasei K.K., is about $7 million, with each company owning half, Ralph Boeker, a Dow vice president, said. The chemicals to be made and marketed by the venture are used in making autos and appliances, he said.

title: REXHAM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including gains of $200,000, or 5 cents a share for the quarter and $800,000, or 20 cents a share for the year reflecting changes in certain pension actuarial assumptions which reduced pension expense. c-Net loss after a pre-tax provision of $3.7 million for the estimated loss on the disposition of the Wright Machinery division and a loss of 40 cents a share from costs associated with a manufacturing problem at the industrial division.

title: House Acts on Voting Hours
description: The House approved a plan today to have all polling places in the 48 contiguous United States close at the same time on Election Day in Presidential years.

description: b-Net income.
