title: MARCOS AIDES CAMAPIGN AGAINST U.S. 'MEDDLING'
description: Aides to President Ferdinand E. Marcos have begun denouncing what they say is American ''meddling'' in the presidential election campaign.

title: Between Corporations, a Handshake Is Not Enough
description: To the Editor:

title: MUSIC: JOHN GRAHAM, VIOLIST
description: JOHN GRAHAM, one of the better violists in our midst, came to Carnegie Recital Hall on Tuesday night to play an assortment of 20th-century works that few listeners - apart from other violists - would have been apt to know. Vaughan Williams was represented by excerpts from his Suite (1934), Shostakovich by his Sonata, Op. 147, and Bergsma by ''Fantastic Variations on a Theme from 'Tristan' '' - these with piano accompaniments played by Robert McDonald.

title: Entrance Exam
description: Frank Layden, general manager and coach of the Utah Jazz, on his days as a student-athlete: ''I wasn't the greatest high school student.

title: 'DEEP SORROW IN MY SOUL,' POPE SAYS
description: Pope John Paul II said today that the deaths of seven Americans on the space shuttle Challenger had ''provoked deep sorrow in my soul.''

title: NORTH AMERICAN COAL CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a tax credit of $2,160,000.

title: The Bonuses of Aging
description: TO THE HOME SECTION:

title: DAY OF DECISION AT THE NAVAL ACADEMY
description: Midshipmen who will graduate from the Naval Academy in June decided this week whether they wanted to be aviators or nuclear submariners, destroyermen or engineers, marines or oceanographers.

title: TUSCON ELECTRIC POWER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of $14.2 million.

title: VISUAL TECHNOLOGY INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After an inventory writedown of $14.1 million to reflect the company's plan to discontinue its personal computer business. Because of a change in its fiscal year, the company's 1984 year had only nine months.

title: Using Savimbi To Stop Moscow
description: To understand the fuss being made in Washington over Jonas Savimbi, leader of the anti-Government forces in Angola, one must accept the curious reality that its significance relates not to Africa but to United States-Soviet relations. While an element of ambiguity surrounds the Administration's intentions, powerful forces are moving our Government toward intervention in the Angolan civil war. The ostensible purpose is to assist Mr. Savimbi's ''freedom-fighters.'' The real purpose is to roll back what is seen as another Soviet expansionist threat. But intervention would fly in the face of the realities of the region and cast a fateful shadow over our relations with Moscow.

title: NEVADA NATIONAL BANCORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income. There are no per share figures for the latest year and the previous quarter and year because net income was exceeded by preferred dividend requirements.

title: STANDFORD TELECOMMUNICAIONS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Australian-Dollar Issue by Hanover
description: The Manufacturers Hanover Corporation yesterday became the latest American banking company to take advantage of good demand from institutional investors for high-yielding debt issues denominated in Australian dollars.

title: USG CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SEALED AIR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
P.L.O. Is Pessimistic On Talk With Hussein
description: Talks between King Hussein of Jordan and Yasir Arafat foundered today, leaving in doubt whether their Middle East peace initiative could be salvaged, according to an official of the Palestine Liberation Organization.

title: FURNISHED BY THEIR OWN 4 HANDS
description: TWELVE-YEAR-OLD Alison Castle has parents who are clever with their hands. Using her ideas, her father, the eminent American furniture maker Wendell Castle, created the post-modern four-poster bed in her room - each of its ash and plastic laminate posts with a pyramidal top functions as a tall cabinet. Her mother, the clay artist Nancy Jurs, reinvented one of the Cabbage Patch dolls that lie at the head of the bed by dressing it in a kimono and giving it blue-black hair with bangs.

title: THOUSANDS IN HAITI STORM A WAREHOUSE OF AID ORGANIZATION
description: Thousands of Haitians stormed the warehouse of the American aid organization CARE tonight, hauling away supplies of cooking oil and wheat as troops and militiamen stood by.

title: FIRST UNION REAL ESTATE EQUITY & MORTGAGE INVESTMENT reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes a gain of $606,000 from the sale of an office building in the quarter and a capital gain of $2,314,000 for the year. c-Includes capital gains of $536,000 in the quarter and $3,755,000 for the year.

title: GORBACHEV EXPRESSES HIS CONDOLENCES
description: Mikhail S. Gorbachev and officials of the Soviet space program sent condolences over the shuttle disaster today, while Muscovites voiced incredulity and shock at the explosion.

title: HARRY GITLIN, LEADER IN NEW APPROACHES TO LIGHTING DESIGN
description: Harry Gitlin, a lighting designer whose innovative works illuminate Lincoln Center and Rockefeller University, died of cancer Monday at his home in Manhattan. He was 72 years old.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: THE SISTERS. By Robert Littell. 312 pages. Bantam. $16.95. THE ENDLESS GAME. By Bryan Forbes. 309 pages. Random House. $17.95. ABOUT a third of the way into

title: Outlaws' Agreement
description: Bill Tatham Jr., owner of the Arizona Outlaws of the United States Football League, said the club's assistant coaches and front-office employees had signed contracts that will limit them to half pay through June 1 in exchange for a guarantee that they will earn 10 percent more than their full salaries by the end of the season. ''It's a great deal,'' said Tatham, noting that incentive clauses tied to attendance and winning percentage could raise the staff's salaries to 35 percent above the full-pay level. The head coach, Frank Kush, who received a guaranteed contract when he joined the team from the Indianapolis Colts in December 1984, was not included in the half-pay plan.

title: Pentagon Surplus Tied To Inflation Estimates
description: The Pentagon received $23 billion more than Congress intended in the last three years because the Defense Department overestimated the inflation rate, according to a study released today.

title: FRED ASTAIRE'S DANCES SEEN FRAME BY FRAME
description: ALTHOUGH Fred Astaire's name often appears on lists of great American dancers and choreographers, his achievements have received comparatively little serious critical scrutiny. Arlene Croce's ''Fred Astaire and Ginger Rogers Book'' (Outerbridge & Lazard Inc., 1972) discusses the films of Mr. Astaire and the most famous of his partners. But, until recently, no one has tried to examine his entire film career.

title: WURLITZER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Restated to reflect a July 1, 1985, sale of the company's vending products subsidiary.

title: FIRST PEOPLES BANK OF N J reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a net gain of $9,091,000 on the sale of branches. There are no per share earnings for the year-ago fourth quarter because net income was exceeded by preferred dividend requirements.

title: MIDWEST FINANCIAL GROUP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income.

title: Minnesota Suspends 2
description: The troubles on the Minnesota basketball team continued yesterday when two players were suspended for violating team rules, leaving only six varsity players. Todd Alexander, a sophomore guard, was suspended for the rest of the season, and Terence Woods, a junior forward, was suspended indefinitely pending further investigation, a statement by the university said.

title: Reading, Donating
description: John F. Kennedy Jr. is seeking contributions of $25 to $500 to the Kennedy Library's permanent endowment in the 25th anniversary year of his father's inauguration. In a letter to potential donors, Mr. Kennedy observes that of all the Presidential libraries, the Kennedy Library is the only one without a permanent private endowment.

title: 80th-Birthday Concert
description: For 47 years, Hildegarde has not been able to lie about her age -not that she would want to, of course.

title: Of Luck And the Bureaucrat
description: A Government agency, political party or business organization can have brilliant leadership, effective managers and dedicated employees but nevertheless stand no better chance of fulfilling its mission than an organization filled with uninspired, incompetent and uncaring personnel.

title: Insider Parole Guidelines
description: The United States Parole Commission voted unanimously today to more than double the time in prison anyone convicted of insider trading must serve to be eligible for parole. The new guidelines are effective April 1.

title: USAT Mortgage Obligations Offer
description: USAT Mortgage Securities is offering $200 million of collaterlaized mortgage obligations backed by a pool of Federal National Mortgage Association pass-through securities through underwriters led by Salomon Brothers Inc.

title: EMERSON RADIO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The share earnings results were adjusted for 10 PC stock dividend declared last October.

title: Profits Scoreboard
description: See accompanying notes for special items. (Loss) * Loss in year-earlier period

title: KOCH FAVORS ETHICS RULE CHANGE
description: Mayor Koch said yesterday that he favored barring the city's county and district political leaders from doing business with the city.

title: GRACE, W R & CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Reading, Writing
description: This week's award for bureaucratic impenetrability goes, alas, to the Library of Congress.

title: CLEVELAND ELECTRIC ILLUMIATING CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
NYNEX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Fourth quarter figures reflect a charge covering the antitrust settlement reached with MCI and elevated expenses associated with NYNEX region damage from Hurricane Gloria in September.

title: Advertising; People
description: * Richard W. Lynch has joined Decker, Decker & Freas as senior vice president and general manager.

title: 4 NEW YORK BUILDINGS CALLED MARCOS GIFTS TO WIFE
description: A New York real estate executive testified before a House panel today that Imelda Marcos, the wife of the Philippine President, told him in 1984 that her main concern about four New York City buildings was to realize or ''pull out $70 million'' by 1987 from the buildings, which he understood she owned.

title: Corn and Wheat Fall; Soybeans Also Decline
description: A decline in corn and wheat prices hit the Chicago Board of Trade today, preceding a Government announcement that could depress prices further.

title: Columbia Gets Funds For Journalism Chair
description: Columbia University has received a gift of $2 million from George T. Delacorte, the publisher and philanthropist, to establish a professorship in journalism, Michael I. Sovern, the university president, announced yesterday.

title: CITY AND M.T.A. AGREE TO MERGE POLICE FORCES
description: The Koch administration and the chairman of the Metropolitan Transportation Authority have agreed to merge the operations of the transit and city police forces, according to city and police officials.

title: EQUIFAX INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a gain of $36,000 from discontinued operations for the quarter, and after a loss of $94,000 from discontinued operations for the year. c-After a loss of $4,061,000 from discontinued operations.

title: MCDONALD & CO INVESTMENTS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
THURSDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Nets vs. Seattle SuperSonics, at Byrne Meadowlands Arena, 7:35 P.M. (Television - SportsChannel, 11:45 P.M. Radio - WNBC 660, 7:30 P.M.) Knicks vs.

title: TELOS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MAYOR CHOOSES LAWYER TO RUN TRANSPORTATION
description: Mayor Koch yesterday named Ross Sandler, an environmental lawyer and mass-transit expert, to be the new Transportation Commissioner.

title: Chevron Receives Iran Settlement
description: The Chevron Corporation said it had received $115 million in settlement of claims stemming from the loss of its assets after the 1979 Iranian revolution.

title: SPACE MUSEUM BECOMES A MEMORIAL
description: Like many Americans, Al Edwards grew up with the space program. As a high school student, he cheered Alan Shepard. While in college, he cut classes to watch John Glenn orbit the earth.

title: Move Over, John Houseman
description: At a Congressional hearing this week, Senator Alfonse M. D'Amato, the New York Republican, demonstrated that he is as concerned as every other American about interest rates on revolving credit accounts.

title: Allied-Signal Sale
description: Charterhouse Group International Inc., an investment firm, said that its Charter Power Systems unit had bought C&D Power Systems from Allied-Signal Inc. for more than $70 million. C&D, based in Plymouth Meeting, Pa., makes industrial batteries and chargers and also supplies fully integrated power systems. Patricia Merrick, a senior vice president of Charterhouse, said participants in the transaction included 15 members of C&D's management, as well as other investors who are shareholders of Charter Power Systems.

title: STANLEY WORKS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Nixon Leaves Hospital For New Jersey Home
description: Former President Nixon returned to his home in Saddle River, N.J., today after spending two days in the hospital for treatment of a viral infection that he contracted in the Bahamas.

title: OFFICIALS REPORT FERRARO APPEARS CLEAR IN INQUIRY
description: The Justice Department is completing a lengthy investigation into Geraldine A. Ferraro's finances and currently has no plans to prosecute her, Federal law-enforcement officials said yesterday.

title: DATASCOPE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of $164,000.

title: GREAT SOUTHERN FEDERAL reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Come Out of the Nutritional Dark Ages
description: To the Editor:

title: Advertising; Addendum
description: * PC World Communications, San Francisco, is expecting to acquire Desktop Publishing magazine from Bove & Rhodes Associates, Woodside, Calif.

title: ALCO HEALTH SERVICES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MURDOCH GETS A COURT INJUNCTION AS BRITISH UNIONS STEP UP FIGHT
description: A strike at four newspapers owned by the publisher Rupert Murdoch went into a fifth day today as union leaders sought to halt publication of the papers and the publisher fought back in the courts.

title: Greece to Buy 40 F-16's From the Manufacturer
description: The Government said today that said it would buy 40 F-16 jet fighters directly from General Dynamics, the manufacturer, and not through an agreement with the United States.

title: QUIXOTE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Advertising; Chase Division's Ads Promote Bank Services
description: Another advertiser that is turning to true stories from inside its own organization is Chase Manhattan's Community Bank, whose J. Michael McLoughlin, vice president and segment marketing manager, believes that the furor in banking over new technology and deregulation is passing and the consumer is now not only ready, but is longing, for advertising that promises services.

title: NORTHEAST UTILITIES reports earnings for Ytr to Dec 31
MESABA AIRLINES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Senate Aide Is Named As Dole's Chief of Staff
description: Sheila P. Burke was named the chief of staff for the Senate majority leader today, making her one of the highest-ranking women on the Senate staff.

title: THE OPERA: 'CAPRICCIO,' BY STRAUSS, IN CONCERT
description: WHEN Richard Strauss set out to write ''Capriccio'' his intention was ''to do something unusual, a treatise on dramaturgy, a theatrical fugue.'' He succeeded in that strange plan, but he and his librettist, Clemens Krauss, went further and produced one of the most fascinating and sophisticated works in the entire opera repertory - that is, insofar as ''Capriccio'' can be said to be in the repertory. Rarely does even the most avid Straussian run across this elegant dramatization of the old debate about the relative importance of words, music and theatrical effects in opera.

title: DESPITE RISING FILM AID, INDEPENDENTS SCRIMP
description: Spike Lee, an independent film maker, learned one day last summer that his latest film was being held hostage. He owed a film processing laboratory about $2,000.

title: SCIENTIFIC COMPUTERS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Conservatives Convene
description: Lest anyone doubt that the conservative tide is running, the organizers of the Conservative Political Action Conference, opening today at the Washington Hilton, report that the number of organizations taking part is the largest in the 13-year history of the gathering. Fifty-three groups, from Accuracy in Media to the Young Conservative Foundation, will hear from speakers who include President Reagan, Vice President Bush, Jeane J. Kirkpatrick, Attorney General Edwin Meese 3d and Senators Bob Dole and Jesse Helms.

title: NORTHWEST TELEPRODUCTIONS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
ROCKEFELLER CENTER PROPERTIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: There are no year-ago figures because the company began operations in 1985.

title: ON FLORIDA COAST, A SOMBER MOOD AND A SENSE OF THE INEVITABLE
description: For more than 20 years the bartenders at Bernard's Surf have poured a free drink for anyone in the lounge when a space flight went up. But on Tuesday there were no takers.

title: MICRO MASK INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income including a pretax gain of $997,000 on the sale of property.

title: DOW GAINS IN HEAVY TRADING
description: The reduction of an important interest rate in Japan produced the third-busiest session ever on Wall Street yesterday, with nearly 194 million shares traded. But prices finished only moderately higher.

title: Bridge: The Devil's Coup May Save Contract That Seems Shaky
description: Exactly how the Devil's Coup received its name is not clear. Perhaps somebody once described it as being devilishly clever, as indeed it is.

title: Treasury Rates Up Modestly
description: Interest rates on Treasury securities rose modestly yesterday, with most of the increase coming before the Treasury announced plans for note and bond financings next week totaling $24 billion.

title: KENTUCKY TOPS L.S.U. ON SHOT AT BUZZER
description: Kentucky pulled out a 54-52 victory tonight over Louisiana State on a 20-foot jumper by Roger Harden at the buzzer.

title: Medicare, Not Medi-scare
description: More and more of us who are senior citizens are becoming uneasy about our prospects for good medical care. As Washington's budget crunch gets ever tighter, the White House and most of Congress unite in thinking that the prime Medicare problem is saving money rather than trying to guarantee senior citizens the same high quality medical care in the future that we have enjoyed in the past.

title: Advertising; New Goal For Aetna Campaign
description: HAVING achieved a hefty increase in consumer awareness of its name by introducing a new ad campaign and doubling its ad budget, Aetna Life and Casualty is now going to try to do the same to increase consumers' estimate of its worth.

title: SHUTTLE'S BUILDERS HAVE VARYING STAKES IN PROGRAM'S FUTURE
description: Many of the leading names in the United States aerospace industry are key contractors in the space shuttle program. As in other major aerospace projects, however, their dependence on the program is not as great as their huge National Aeronautics and Space Administration contracts might suggest because a great deal of the work is passed to hundreds of subcontractors.

title: CONCERT: TRIO MAKES DEBUT
description: THE pianist Paul Ostrovsky has been playing trio repertory with Liba Shacht (violin) and Charles Curtis (cello) for a little over a year, and the three musicians made a formal joint debut as the New York Piano Trio at the 92d Street Y Tuesday. Henceforth, however, they intend to drop the word ''piano'' from their ensemble logo.

title: Strauss's Last Opera
description: The last of Richard Strauss's 15 completed operas, ''Capriccio'' was composed in the midst of World War II and given its first performance in Munich on Oct. 28, 1942. The idea for the work stemmed from an 18th-century opera text by the Abbate Casti, ''Prima la Musica, e poi le Parole'' (''First the Music, and then the Words''), set by Antonio Salieri in 1786.

title: PROBATION UNIT TO FIGHT DEFERRED SENTENCING
description: Lawyers for New York City's Probation Department will go to court tomorrow to challenge the right of judges to place criminals on interim probation between the time of conviction and sentencing.

title: REGENCY ELECTRONICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income.

title: Between Corporations, a Handshake Is Not Enough
description: To the Editor:

title: SYM-TEK SYSTEMS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MANHATTAN CABLE SUED OVER ACCESS
description: A Manhattan citizens group filed suit yesterday in Federal District Court, accusing Manhattan Cable TV, a subsidiary of Time Inc., of illegally denying some pay-television services access to its cable system.

title: THE MOURNING FAMILIES RETURN HOME
description: For seven long and mournful minutes this morning church bells pealed all over the city of Houston, the nation's space capital, from which seven space travelers began a fateful journey that ended Tuesday when the space shuttle Challenger exploded over the Atlantic.

title: FINANCIAL CORP OF AMERICA reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary tax credit of $43,712,000, or $1.22 a share, a gain of $287.2 million from the sale of loans, a charge of $5.7 million for a Federal Savings & Loan Insurance Corp. special assessment and an addition to the provision for loan loss reserves of $156.4 million. c-Net loss including an extraordinary gain of $12,064,000 from a Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp. stock dividend.

title: Frates Group Lifts Its Offer for Kaiser
description: An investor group led by the Oklahoma investor Joseph A. Frates said today that it would sweeten its offer for the Kaiser Aluminum and Chemical Corporation by $1.50 a share, to $21.50.

title: Advertising; New Agency Promotes Nonprescription Drugs
description: Robert Brancaccio, 49 years old; Peter Christofer, 33, and Karen Irland Shields, 32, who all worked together at Sudler & Hennessey, a major force among health care ad agencies, have just opened their own agency, Brancaccio/Christofer/ Shields.

title: CHILDREN MAKE CONTRIBUTIONS TO AID NEEDIEST CASES FUND
description: Children expressing their concern for other children who are in need of care and shelter are among the contributors to the 74th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: SILICON GENERAL INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 29
description: b-Net income.

title: SCHERING-PLOUGH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MOST CONTRAS REPORTED TO PULL OUT OF NICARAGUA
description: At a time when they once promised to begin a major offensive, Nicaraguan guerrillas are instead back in their camps in Honduras, checked by improved Sandinista tactics and a critical shortage of supplies, rebel officials and Western diplomats here say.

title: EUROPEANS EXPECT DELAYED PROJECTS
description: The explosion of the space shuttle Challenger is expected to have far-reaching effects on the pace and perhaps the future of European space projects, government and industry officials in several European countries said today.

title: CENTRAL WISCONSIN BANKHARES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DEBRIS IS PULLED FROM THE SEA
description: A broad-based inquiry began on three fronts today into the cause of the explosion of the shuttle Challenger, history's worse space disaster.

title: SOUTHERN HOME SAVINGS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Year-ago per share figures are not applicable because the company converted from mutual to stock form in December 1984. Per share figures were adjusted for a 20 percent stock dividend paid on Jan. 20.

title: Whirlpool Cleared To Buy Kitchenaid
description: A Federal appeals court in Cincinnati cleared the way for the Whirlpool Corporation to buy Kitchenaid, the Ohio-based appliance maker, from Dart & Kraft Inc. The United States Court of Appeals for the Sixth Circuit unanimously approved the purchase, which was announced in January 1985 but challenged by two dishwasher companies. White Consolidated Industries and Magic Chef Inc. had said the merger would hamper competition, Whirlpool said, but the appeals court upheld a lower court ruling that it would not.

title: ISRAEL'S PREMIER, IN WEST BERLIN, APPEALS TO SOVIET TO LET JEWS GO
description: Prime Minister Shimon Peres appealed to the Soviet Union tonight to allow Jews to emigrate to Israel, and he urged Moscow to assume a positive role in the search for peace in the Middle East.

title: REAGAN TO LEAD MEMORIAL IN HOUSTON
description: President Reagan will fly to Houston on Friday to lead the nation in a memorial service for the seven crew members killed Tuesday in the explosion of the space shuttle Challenger, the White House announced today.

title: Giants Stay in Stadium
description: San Francisco Giants owner Bob Lurie, who vowed after last season that his team had played its last game in Candlestick Park, said yesterday the team would play its 1986 schedule in the much-maligned stadium. ''Two things have occurred which have caused me to change my mind,'' Lurie said in a statement. ''First, I firmly believe an agreement is within reach that will lead to construction of a new downtown stadium; second, new president and general manager Al Rosen and new manager Roger Craig have brought a promise of excitement to the team that Bay area fans deserve to see.''

title: HUGE AUDIENCE FOR SHUTTLE COVERAGE
description: Viewers hungry for information about the space-shuttle disaster caused a sharp increase in network news ratings Tuesday night.

title: Digging Under a Church
description: Two weeks ago, workers repairing a wall in the basement of the John Street United Methodist Church at 44 John Street came across some bones. And then more bones.

title: CORRECTION
description: A television review yesterday on the networks' reporting about the space shuttle explosion described NBC's ''Today'' coverage for the West Coast incorrectly. It was live, not filmed.

title: Pencils, Books, Dirty Looks
description: Dan C. Alexander, president of Save Our Schools, a conservative, back-to-basics educational lobbying organization, has written a 130-page indictment of the politically potent National Education Association, maintaining that the old-line professional organization has transmogrified into ''a radical political union that does not represent the views of parents, students or even the majority of American teachers.''

title: U.S. Promotes China Expert
description: Richard H. Solomon, a China expert, was appointed today to direct the policy planning staff of the State Department. Mr. Solomon has served on the National Security Council, taught at the University of Michigan and written three books about China. He succeeds Peter W. Rodman, who is moving to the National Security Council to oversee foreign policy there.

title: SHOULD U.S. CONTINUE TO SEND PEOPLE INTO SPACE?
description: The explosion of the space shuttle Challenger Tuesday is raising anew the question of whether it is worth the risk and the expense for the United States to send people into space.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''The people of Uganda should only die from natural causes which are not under our control.'' - Yoweri Museveni, the new President of Uganda. [ A3:1. ]

title: ARMSTRONG RUBBER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
EXECUTIVES
description: * American Express Travel Related Services Co., a subsidiary of the American Express Co., has named Roger H. Ballou executive vice president, Travel Management Services.

Chairman Sets Goals For Uniroyal-Goodrich
description: During the 12 years that Patrick C. Ross directed the B. F. Goodrich Company's mainstay, its tire division, Uniroyal Inc. was a persistent competitor.

description: When the Treasury Department's Bureau of Alcohol, Tobacco and Firearms seizes anything, it is required by law to place notices in local newspapers in case someone has a valid claim to the property.

title: 11th Ring Is Reported Found Circling Uranus
description: Voyager 2 has found an 11th ring circling Uranus, a faint 1,900-mile-wide ribbon of material orbiting inside the other rings and only 7,000 miles above the planet's cloudtops, scientists said today.

title: EX-F.B.I. AGENT IS SELECTED AS STATE INSPECTOR GENERAL
description: Governor Cuomo today appointed a former F.B.I. agent to head a newly created Office of State Inspector General to look for fraud, abuse and corruption in eight state government agencies.

title: BETHLEHEM REPORTS LOSS OF $77.5 MILLION IN PERIOD
description: The Bethlehem Steel Corporation yesterday reported a $77.5 million loss in the fourth quarter of 1985, compared with a loss of $64.5 million in the fourth quarter of 1984.

title: LOSS A FURTHER BLOW TO NASA'S BUSINESS EFFORTS
description: The unexplained destruction of the shuttle Challenger on Tuesday may cripple for several years NASA's already-flagging efforts to make its shuttle fleet the centerpiece of commercial exploitation of space.

title: U.S. Embassy in India Denies Report on Spying
description: The United States Embassy denied today that any of its diplomats had ''engaged in espionage'' with an Indian businessman who was accused Tuesday of passing secrets to several American officials.

title: A GREEK SQUARE IN QUEENS STARTS A CLASSIC DEBATE
description: The argument involves the ancients. It is philosophy against drama, stone versus metal, women pressing for a presence in a venerated circle of men.

title: Executive Chosen As Amex President
description: The American Stock Exchange announced yesterday that Kenneth R. Leibler, a senior executive vice president, had been named president and chief operating officer.

description: In a new estimate, the Congressional Budget Office now projects a Federal deficit of $178 billion in the 1987 fiscal year, far less than earlier estimates.

title: EAGLES SIGN RYAN
description: Buddy Ryan, the architect of the Chicago Bears' defense that allowed only 10 points in three playoff games, was named today as the new head coach of the Philadelphia Eagles.

title: ANTI-SANDINISTA ADVISER LISTS AID NEEDS OF REBELS
description: A key adviser to the Nicaraguan rebels said today that they would use American military aid, if it is approved, to create secure supply lines inside Nicaragua and to acquire anti-aircraft weapons, long-range mortars and artillery.

The year results are after charges of $6 million, or 12 cents a share, related to an employee retirement program and other costs. c-Including gains on the sale of property of $3.2 million for the quarter and $9 million for the year. description: The Financial Corporation of America reported today that it earned $97 million, or $2.58 a share, in the fourth quarter, giving it an overall profit in 1985 of $53.3 million.

title: Fire at Catholic School Razes All but Gymnasium in Jersey
description: A fire swept through a Roman Catholic elementary school early today, demolishing the school and forcing the cancellation of all classes in public schools a few hundred yards away, the police said.

title: HYDROGEN USED IN MAIN ENGINES: AN EFFICIENT BUT DANGEROUS FUEL
description: The destruction of the space shuttle Challenger vividly underscored the danger and destructive power of the hydrogen that fueled the orbiter's main engines.

description: Per share figures reflect 4-for-3 stock split paid in November.

title: A NUCLEAR PLANT IN CONNECTICUT GETS GO-AHEAD
description: The Millstone 3 nuclear plant, under construction for more than 11 years, received approval today from the Nuclear Regulatory Commission to begin operating at full power.

description: b-Including a tax credit of $1,972,000. c-Including a tax credit of $1,651,000.

description: b-Including a tax credit of $1,662,000.

title: MILITARY STUDIES OTHER WAYS OF PUTTING SATELLITES IN ORBIT
description: Military officials today began studying alternative ways of delivering their satellites into orbit as a result of the explosion of the space shuttle Challenger.

title: DESPITE COOLNESS, CUOMO AND KOCH ASSERT THEY CAN STILL WORK TOGETHER
description: Personal dislike between Governor Cuomo and Mayor Koch seems apparent to anyone who has listened to their public exchanges, particularly in recent weeks.

title: BUDGET OFFICE LIMITED ON DELAYS
description: A Federal district judge here ruled today that the Office of Management and Budget could not delay the issuing of a regulation by the Environmental Protection Agency beyond a deadline set by Congress.

title: CUTTER BRINGS 600 POUNDS OF DEBRIS OF SHUTTLE TO PORT
description: The Coast Guard cutter Point Roberts and its saddened, weary crew docked here this afternoon, bringing back 600 pounds of bits and pieces of the space shuttle Challenger and the first eyewitness accounts of the search.

title: UNFIT DAY-CARE CENTERS AT ISSUE IN IDAHO FIGHT
description: As the ranks of working mothers swell -and despite some reports of molesting at child-care centers - more and more children are being placed in the hands of strangers in Idaho, the last state with no statewide day-care regulation.

title: Howard Johnson Signs
description: The Mets have signed Howard Johnson to a one-year contract for $225,000 and reduced their number of potential arbitration cases to six. Johnson, obtained last year in a trade with the Detroit Tigers for Walt Terrell, became the Mets' 78th third baseman. He batted .242 in 126 games, with 11 home runs. He earned $115,000 last year and was seeking a raise to $250,000 against the Mets' offer of $175,000. .

title: Handling Bad News
description: In June 1969, White House speechwriters were crafting phrases President Nixon might use in congratulating the first men to land on the moon. We assumed a safe return, but were drawn up short by a call from Frank Borman, the astronaut assigned by NASA to be White House liaison.

title: PLAZA COMMERCE BANCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Burlington Notes
description: Burlington Northern Inc. increased the size of its 10-year note offering to $300 million from $250 million and offered the 9 5/8 percent issue at a price of 99.30 to yield 9.736 percent through underwriters led by Morgan Stanley & Company. The notes, rated A-2 by Moody's and A by S.&P., yield nearly 67-hundredths of a percentage point more than 10-year Treasury notes.

title: BIG APARTMENT, SMALL RENT? LUCKY YOU
description: MARY KATHERINE CORBETT is one of a handful of lucky Manhattan residents with a rent-controlled or rent-stabilized apartment three times the size of the rent instead of the other way around. Unlike many who are making do in stamp-size studios or making ends meet by taking in roommates, a fortunate few in Manhattan have no reason to panic when the rent check is due, no reason to reconsider when they think of having 8 or 12 or even 24 to dinner. After all, this small but envied group are living in well-kept buildings and paying from $300 to just under $700 for 760 to 2,000 square feet.

title: IMASCO LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The company is listed on the Montreal, Toronto and Vancouver stock exchanges.

title: WEIS MARKETS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
GOING OUT GUIDE
description: EMIGRES The emigre educator and artist seems to be one of the enduring symbols of upheaval. Refugees from Hitler's Europe founded schools and publishing houses and art galleries in New York. Several years ago, an orchestra of emigre musicians from the Soviet Union was organized here. And tonight at 8 o'clock, an orchestra born out of the flight from the Hungarian revolt against Communist authorities 30 years ago plays at Carnegie Hall (247-7800).

title: BATTLE FOR SOUTHERN YEMEN: HOW THE FURY BEGAN
description: A gangland-style massacre by President Ali Nasser Mohammed al-Hassani of his rivals in the ruling Marxist party's Politburo touched off more than a week of bitter house-to-house battles and a rebellion that drove him from office, according to authoritative Southern Yemeni sources.

description: The decision by the New England Patriots to adopt their own drug-testing program appears to have intensified the sentiment among league and club executives that mandatory drug testing should be included in the next collective bargaining agreement.

title: Phone Service Competition
description: State governments should stop regulating local telephone rates and should end the monopoly that local telephone companies have to perform this consumer service, a top Federal regulator said today.

JAPAN CUTS BASIC RATE BY 1/2 POINT
description: After days of anticipation, the Bank of Japan officially announced today that it would cut Japan's basic interest rate in a bid to spur economic growth. It is the first reduction since Oct. 22, 1983.

title: Key Rates
description: * Municipal Bond Index, The Bond BuyerSalomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: TAMES PHOTOS ON VIEW
description: ''You have to love politicians,'' the man was saying. ''You put me in a room full of people, with five politicians, and I can spot them right away. I know and appreciate politicians.''

title: Market Place; Carter Hawley Stock Studied
description: TWO years ago Carter Hawley Hale Stores had more than its share of problems. The highly competitive environment in California eroded the market share of the nation's 10th-largest retailer, profit margins narrowed because of high overhead and then the owner of the Neiman-Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman chains found itself embroiled in a life-and-death takeover struggle.

title: Working Profile: John C. Whitehead; Parting the Fog at Foggy Bottom
description: At the State Department, where ambiguity in speech and obfuscation in actions have become finely developed tools, the new No. 2 official, John C. Whitehead, has startled a number of aides by his preference for straight talk and crisp decisions.

title: UNITED STATES SURGICAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses on the sale of investments of $1,470,000 for the quarter and $5,098,000 for the year and including tax credits of $379,000 for the quarter and $856,000 for the year. c-Net loss. d-After a charge of $4,025,000 for the quarter and the year representing costs of stockholder litigation, a charge of $2,768,000 for the year for the cumulative effect of an accounting change and including a tax credit of $785,000 for the quarter and the year.

title: Washington Reaction
description: Preston Martin, vice chairman of the Federal Reserve Board, said today that he was pleased by the reduction in the Bank of Japan's discount rate.

title: CERPROBE CORP reports earnings for Yr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: 100.000 Bits of Fossil Found in Nova Scotia
description: More than 100,000 bits of bones from crocodiles, dinosaurs and fish that lived 200 million years ago have been found in Nova Scotia, Canada, forming the largest fossil find in North America, scientists said today.

title: VESTRON INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Maynard's Missing Vote
description: In pro football history, no other pass receiver accumulated more yardage or more 100-yard games. Only one other pass-receiver scored more touchdowns. And yet Don Maynard, once of the New York Jets, has been turned away again at the door of the Pro Football Hall of Fame. He belongs in bronze as much as any pass-receiver who ever played. But sadly, he's not there. Not yet anyway. Maybe because of a mysteriously missing vote. More and more, entrance into this Hall of Fame requires as much patience as accomplishment.

title: ONE BANCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Includes an extraordinary gain of $264,000, a Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corp. stock distribution.

title: OSMONICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Oil Futures Prices Slip While Spot Prices Gain
description: Prices for crude oil and petroleum products logged a mixed record on the oil markets in quiet trading yesterday. The major United States and British crude oils showed slight gains on the open, or spot, market. But crude prices slipped on the futures markets and prices for products uniformly slipped lower on both exchanges.

title: 2 ISRAELI SOLDIERS KILLED BY GUNMAN AT JORDAN RIVER
description: A gunman wearing civilian clothes and carrying Jordanian Army identity papers crossed the Jordan River today and shot at an Israeli patrol, killing two soldiers and wounding two others, an Israeli Army spokesman said.

title: LAST TROOPS ARE WITHDRAWN FROM HORMEL PLANT
description: Gov. Rudy Perpich today ordered the remaining 500 National Guardsmen to withdraw from the gates of the Geo. A. Hormel & Company plant in Austin as workers crossed the picket lines of striking meatpackers without incident.

title: Massenet Operas
description: Excerpts from Massenet's ''Therese'' and ''Manon'' will be staged by the Bel Canto Opera Saturday night at 8 o'clock at the Joan of Arc School Theater, 154 West 93d Street. Johannes Somary will conduct a cast that includes Jane Ferguson, Tamara Mitchel, Thomas Tomasiewicz, and Gordon Voorhees. Tickets are $10 and $15; information: 279-4200.

title: SOUTHWESTERN BELL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a net gain of $27 million in the quarter and the year from an adjustment reducing annual pension expense; and a non-recurring gain of $57 million in the year from Yellow Pages directories income. c-Including $26 million in non-recurring net income.

title: Advertising; Eighth Subaru Account For Levine, Huntley
description: In New York, Levine, Huntley, Schmidt & Beaver, which is the agency for the Subaru of America account and for seven of the 13 dealer advertising associations, has just picked up its eighth, the Subaru of Southern California.

title: The U.N. Today
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on Non-Use of Force -10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M. ECONOMIC AND

title: SJW CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
PERFECT DATA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: Advertising; Cruise-Goers See Game Via Shipboard Network
description: The passengers cruising aboard the Queen Elizabeth 2 somewhere off the west coast of South America Sunday had the opportunity to watch the Super Bowl because the liner was recently equipped with a satellite dish picking up a signal from Comsat. The football game was transmitted thanks to the Shipboard Satellite Network, a fledgling company in Northvale, N.J.

title: DEVILS LOSE AGAIN AT HOME
description: The Devils played another uninspired home game tonight, losing their seventh straight at Byrne Meadowlands Arena, this time by 4-1 to the Pittsburgh Penguins.

title: AMERICAN COMMUNICATIONS & TELEVISION INC reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title:
GARDENING;
A SNOWFALL: NATURE'S MULCH
description: WHEN snow falls on the New York Botanical Garden the gardeners take shelter, finding work in the warmth of the greenhouses. Except, that is, for Karl Grieshaber. The curator of alpine plants shoulders a shovel and heads out to clear the paths in his rock garden. He does so not for the convenience of GARDENING visitors, since his garden is closed to the public during the winter months. He just hates to waste the precious snow.

title: Dutch National Named Head of J. Aron Division
description: Mark O. Winkelman, a 39-year-old Dutch national, has been named partner in charge of the J. Aron commodities trading division of Goldman, Sachs & Company, the big Wall Street investment banking firm.

title: KEMPTON DUNN
description: Kempton Dunn, former chairman and chief executive officer of the Abex Corporation, died Friday at Stamford (Conn.) Hospital. He was 76 years old and lived in New Canaan, Conn.

title: BRIEFS
description: Debt

title: A Solid Record on Solid Waste
description: After nearly eight years of managing New York City's mountainous waste disposal system, Sanitation Commissioner Norman Steisel is leaving public service for the investment business. He deserves warm appreciation for mastering a job that is truly central to the city's survival.

title: INDIA'S 12 MILLION CATHOLICS WAIT PROUDLY FOR POPE
description: Wearing white cassocks, priests ride motorcycles through the old streets of Goa. Worshipers flock to mass on Sundays, and from the shadows of Bom Jesus Basilica comes a choir's soft hymn, accompanied by violins and guitar.

title: TRANSTECHNOLOGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
I.D.A. Loan Plan Set
description: The United States has agreed with other donors to work toward a $12 billion replenishment of the World Bank's soft loan affiliate, the International Development Association, senior bank officials said today. A two-day meeting of 34 donor countries here also agreed on a framework for discussing future changes in the association's lending terms and the distribution of its loan progams, they said.

title: CPT CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CONCERT: RUGGLES AND WEBERN WORKS IN 'FOCUS!'
description: THE Juilliard School's ''Focus!'' series continued Tuesday night and, for the most part, gave support to the thesis - propounded by the director of the festival, Joel Sachs - that the years from 1918 to 1933 represented a musical golden age.

title: WESTERN AIR LINES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a charge of $3.2 million from the reversal of a tax credit and a gain of $6.8 million from the sale of property for the quarter and gains of $31.7 million from a tax credit and $29.1 million from the sale of property for the year. c-After a gain of $256 million from the sale of property. d-Net loss after a gain $11.3 million from the sale of property.

title: SCAN-OPTICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SERVO CORP OF AMERICA reports earnings for Qtr to Oct 31
U.S. NICHE IN COMPACT DISKS
description: When the compact disk arrived on the audio scene three years ago to general fanfare, many of the most demanding hi-fi enthusiasts and many American stereo manufacturers dismissed it. The new medium, they said, fell short of the sonic perfection claimed by its developers, offering a sound that was harsh, strident, ''mid-fi,'' at best.

title: GREAT WESTERN SAVINGS, A FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After an extraordinary charge of $486,000.

title: THEATER: 'A LIFE LIKE THE REST' BY KEVIN ARKADIE
description: THE survival of a rural Virginia black family of five, of which both parents and one of two sons are seriously mentally retarded, in the face of efforts by a misguided social worker and her agency to make them wards of the state is the story of ''A Life Like the Rest,'' Kevin Arkadie's play being presented by the Frederick Douglass Creative Arts Center at the Judith Anderson Theater. Indeed, the moral superiority of this family is so obvious that the social worker does not stand a chance against it; she may frighten them and even cruelly injure several of them, but by the end of the first of 10 scenes in this two-act play the audience can be confident she will lose.

title: Zondervan Stake
description: An investor group consisting of the New York-based broker Edward A. Viner & Company and a private investor, Robert I. Toussie, said it had raised its stake in the Zondervan Corporation to 7.1 percent, from 6.3 percent, of the shares outstanding.

title: Bubka Out
description: Sergei Bubka, the world outdoor-record holder in the pole vault, who had been expected to compete in the Millrose Games Feb. 14 at Madison Square Garden against Billy Olson, the record indoor vaulter, will not make the trip. Howard Schmertz, the meet director, said he had been informed by Soviet authorities that Bubka had a conflict with a Soviet sports festival and would not compete here until the USA/ Mobil Track and Field Championships at Madison Square Garden Feb. 28.

title: SUN STATE SAVINGS & LOAN ASSOC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MODERNISM OF MIES: FRESH SIGNS OF VIGOR
description: JUST when post-modern buildings and interiors embellished with columns, cornices, pastel colors and Palladian motifs have become accepted in the mainstream of popular taste, some architects are re-evaluating elements of the architectural style that preceded it - the modern movement - and the designs of one of it's masters, Ludwig Mies van der Rohe.

title: CLINIC OFFERS AID FOR FERTILIZATION
description: Innovative techniques developed in Australia to deal with infertility, such as the freezing of embryos for allocation to several attempts at gestation, are to be offered by a fertilization clinic in Port Chester, N.Y., starting in March.

title: KOCH SAYS FRIEDMAN HAS POWER TO KILL BILLS IN COUNCIL ON TAXIS
description: Mayor Koch asserted yesterday that the Bronx Democratic leader, Stanley M. Friedman, had exercised a virtual veto power in the City Council over city legislation affecting the taxi industry.

title: YELLOW FREIGHT SYSTEM INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BLACK HAWKS RALLY TO DEFEAT RANGERS
description: It is the simplest of plays, the kind that usually produces nothing at all. The skater circles behind the net, as if sneaking behind the goalkeeper's back and then tries to slip the puck past the goalie's feet. Usually it does not work.

title: LEGISLATORS HINT SUPPORT FOR NEW SHUTTLE, BUT BUDGET LIMITS ARE A CONCERN
description: Congressional leaders today generally supported the idea of replacing the space shuttle that exploded over Florida on Tuesday, but they admitted that budget restrictions might make it difficult to find the money.

title: Armco Unit
description: Armco Inc. said its Eastern Steel division needs almost $500 million in capital investments during the next five years to upgrade two Kentucky plants and is asking division employees to help find those funds. Division officers were asked to study cost improvements. These studies will include seeking additional sales and evaluating whether further savings can be achieved.

title: The Dignified Part
description: In the hours after the explosion of the shuttle Challenger, people waited: Not for an answer, because there could be none yet, but for words of consolation. They came, with rare grace, from President Reagan.

title: KALVAR CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 28
description: There are no share earnings for the latest 9 months and the year-ago quarter and 9 months because net income was exceeded by preferred dividends.

title: DURAKON INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a gain of $157,000 for the quarter and a loss of $99,000 for the year from discontinued operations. The earnings per share have been restated for a 50 PC stock dividend to be paid Feb. 3.

title: SILVERCREST INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net losses. Results are restated to reflect the acquisition of Santiago Corp. on Jan. 8, 1986 on a pooling-of-interests basis.

title: Advertising; Sun Banks Account
description: Tucker Wayne & Company of Atlanta has won the Sun Banks of Florida account that was briefly served at Ally & Gargano, New York. The Atlanta agency is already working for the Trust Company Banks of Georgia, owned by the Sun Trust Banks, a holding company that recently acquired the Florida operation.

title: MUSIC: RUDOLF SERKIN
description: RUDOLF SERKIN'S recital last night at Carnegie Hall differed in few respects from many others he has given there over the years. That is, it was a profoundly satisfying musical event, with the accent on the word musical. Mr. Serkin, though a virtuoso down to his fingertips (where else?), has always been a magnificent musician first and a magnificent pianist second, reversing the usual order. More than half a century after his American debut, the 82-year-old pianist retains a heroic though not flawless technique, which on this occasion as always, remained subordinated to the sense of the work.

title: Rumanian Missing in Greece
description: A Rumanian diplomat disappeared in Greece on Friday after his arrival as part of a four-member trade delegation, a Government spokesman said today. The spokesman, Antonis Kourtis, declined to comment on whether the diplomat, identified in press reports as Jorge Yabasso, had sought political asylum in Greece or elsewhere.

title: A Message From Qaddafi
description: Col. Muammar el-Qaddafi, the Libyan leader, tonight sent his ''personal condolences'' to families of the Americans killed aboard the space shuttle Challenger and said he was ''deeply saddened'' by the tragedy.

title: U.S. OFFICIALS SEE CORRUPTION LINK TO JUDGE'S CASE
description: Justice Department officials said yesterday that they believed there was a link between payoffs involving the New York City Parking Violations Bureau and possible corruption among Queens judges and Queens Democratic Party officials.

title: LAM RESEARCH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 29
description: b-Including tax credits of $105,000 for the quarter and $175,000 for the 6 months. c-Including a tax credit of $198,000.

title: Why Give Politicians $50,000?
description: By now, every New Yorker knows that Queens Borough President Donald Manes stands accused of extorting $36,000 from a collection agency seeking a Parking Violations Bureau contract. But what of the $10,000 campaign contribution he accepted openly last spring from a Queens developer grateful for help in winning approval of a 28-story office tower? Whether or not the contribution was innocent, the suspicions it invites can corrode public confidence in government just as surely.

title: CALFED INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Contamination Brings Alert at 3 Mile Island
description: A worker at Three Mile Island's damaged Unit 2 nuclear reactor was contaminated Tuesday, bringing on a low-level emergency, according to the operator of the plant.

title: Airliner Crash Kills 21 People in Mexico
description: An AeroCalifornia DC-3 slammed into a hill and burst into flames today when it tried to land at a small, foggy airstrip on the Pacific coast. All 21 people aboard were killed, officials said.

title: With Our Own Eyes
description: If Thomas Jefferson had come back to visit this week, what would have amazed him more, the explosion of a huge vehicle headed for space, or watching that explosion on television, along with millions of other spectators around the world?

title: CALENDAR: FLOWERS, SCULPTURE, WEAVING
description: Wildflowers, New York Botanical Garden, Bronx; 212-220-8747.

title: DIVESTITURE VOTED IN SAN FRANCISCO
description: As a protest against South Africa's policy of racial segregation, this city's Board of Supervisors has unanimously approved a strong measure that would bar San Francisco from purchasing goods and services from many companies doing business in South Africa.

title: LaFontaine Works Out
description: Pat LaFontaine, the Islanders' center who may have suffered a separated right shoulder in the third period of a 3-3 tie with Chicago Saturday night, participated in a light skate yesterday in addition to his off-ice training.

title: SKEPTICISM ON BANK EARNINGS
description: Continuing a winning streak begun early last year, most of the nation's major banks reported higher earnings per share in the fourth quarter of 1985. But, in a widening debate, there was considerable disagreement over the ''quality'' of those earnings and the prospect of maintaining them.

title: Denial on Bids By Bingham
description: Barry Bingham Sr. says that no companies have been invited to become potential bidders on the three communications companies he has placed on the market.

title: HOME BEAT
description: MAYBE it was because he was a graphic designer that Tom Penn, top right, ''felt a compulsion to do something that had a longer shelf life'' and started working on a series of furniture pieces in which he combined such disparate materials and textures as iron and blown glass, steel and marble. His first efforts include the Sling chair he is sitting in, which has an iron frame and buffalo hide seat and back, $2,500, as well as his multilevel stone table, which combines rough edges and smoothly polished surfaces, top, $1,700; a small oval side table, above, $1,900, and a version of his linear dining chairs with iron frames, right, $1,700.

title: INQUIRY AGENDA: MANY QUESTIONS BUT NO ANSWERS
description: Space agency engineers began poring over manufacturing and test records and flight data today in an exhaustive search for answers to the many questions raised by the explosion of the space shuttle Challenger.

title: Alabama, Ohio State In Kickoff
description: Alabama and Ohio State will meet in the fourth annual Kickoff Classic at Giants Stadium next summer.

description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of $30,000 from stock dividends after taxes from the Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation.

title: SMALL BANK REVIVES URBAN AREA
description: In 1973, when many urban banks were eagerly lending money as far afield as South America, officials at Chicago's South Shore Bank had a vision closer to home - to revitalize 265 square blocks in a decaying community on the city's South Side.

title: OIL OFFICIALS ARE SAID TO LEAVE LIBYA
description: About a dozen top managers of American oil companies have quietly left Libya in the last few days, according to business executives and diplomats here.

description: President Reagan, eulogizing the victims of the space shuttle explosion, drew upon a sonnet, ''High Flight,'' written by an American airman killed in World War II.

description: ANDIRONS, fire screens and tool sets are the obvious accouterments to a fireplace, but many other items can grace the hearth as well as serve a purpose.

title: 'ECONOMICS OF AGING,' ON CHANNEL 13
description: ''CURRENTS,'' Channel 13's weekly series on societal change, takes a very respectable look tonight at an interesting topic: life care. The program, ''Life Care: The Economics of Aging,'' visits institutions that care for elderly people, more or less in return for their savings. Some of the institutions do this quite well; others are financial failures. ''Currents'' will be seen at 8:30 P.M.

description: * Anderson Clayton & Co., Houston, announced completion of the sale of American Founders Life Insurance Co. to Continental Fidelity Life Insurance Co. for $58 million.

WOULD YOU BELIEVE? SAMPSON AT GUARD
description: At the practice session before the All-Star Game last year in Indianapolis, Pat Riley of the Los Angeles Lakers, who was coaching the West team, talked about the possibility of playing 7-foot-4-inch Ralph Sampson of the Houston Rockets in the backcourt. He never did. This year Riley could play Sampson in the backcourt and still have a front line of 7-footers in the Feb. 9 All-Star Game in Dallas.

title: ALPINE CHIC: OLD MONEY TIPS ITS HAT TO THE NEW
description: The steeply inclined main street of this chic holiday town is lined with what might be called luxury vacation shops, conveniently arrayed in the shadow of the sparkling mountains. There is a Gucci's, a

title: Topics; When the Blood Runs Cold Winter Walk
description: Like countless other New Yorkers, a friend of ours has been living in a climate that mimics spring. Storm windows baffle drafts; a cotton ''snake'' is stretched along the space where the front door doesn't quite meet the floor; the amaryllis and hyacinth from the supermarket have behaved as promised.

title: East Harlem Remembers
description: Dr. Ronald E. McNair, the astronaut who was the second black American to leave the earth on a shuttle mission, did not live in East Harlem in Manhattan, but in the Clear Lake area near Houston.

title: DEMOCRATS IN SENATE INDICATE THEY WILL SUPPORT A TAX RISE
description: The Senate Democratic Conference, in a statement of budget priorities, expressed support today for selected tax increases to reduce the Federal budget deficit.

description: The Transamerica Corporation said today that it plans to sell its air travel, car rental and manufacturing businesses as part of a long-term plan to concentrate on insurance and financial services.

title: General Nutrition Acts
description: General Nutrition Inc. plans to cut costs by closing 200 of its 1,315 stores and abolishing two foreign subsidipresident of finance, said Wednesday that the health food retailer expects a loss in its final quarter, ending Friday, and the whole fiscal year.

title: Preferred Stock Issue By Procter & Gamble
description: The Procter & Gamble Company is offering $250 million of auction preferred stock in three parts, through underwriters led by Goldman, Sachs & Company.

title: Roberto Duran Is Trying Again
description: Roberto Duran, former lightweight, welterweight and junior-middleweight champion, returns to the prize ring tonight in Panama, embarked on yet another comeback in a career that long ago seemed to be saying no mas.

title: The K.G.B. Gets Less Bang for the Ruble
description: The intelligence services in the Communist bloc apparently are no longer concerned about getting value for their money. Reports of their spending profligacy seem so extraordinary that they warrant a closer look.

title: The Great Wall Of Southern Cal
description: In the spring of 1982, Chao Ying Zhang had been in the United States for less than a year when an intermediary arranged for him to meet Bob Yoder, coach of the University of Southern California's men's volleyball team. It was a strange visit.

title: Immigration of the Fittest
description: There's a better way to decide who gets to be an American, contends Julian Simon, who teaches business administration at the University of Maryland. He gave it in an Op-Ed article the other day.

title: People Express Officer Picked to Head Frontier
description: Larry R. Martin, only 36 years old but a veteran at People Express, is heading to Denver to be president of Frontier Airlines. The move will make him the the youngest head of a major air carrier.

title: Advertising; Black & Decker Division Shift
description: McCann-Erickson/New York has won the United States Household Products division of the Black & Decker Corporation, made up largely of the appliances that the company acquired from the General Electric Company. Billings could exceed $20 million.

title: XEROX CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including in the quarter $44 million in discontinued operations which represented operating income from one publishing company, University Microfilms International and gain from its sale; and reflecting, in the year, two special charges totaling $164 million that the company took in the third quarter in connection with its insurance operations, as well as a one-time gain of $200 million from the sale of six Xerox publishing companies. c-Net loss, including a $65 million loss in discontinued operations from the combined operating results from six publishing companies and Industrial Indemnity Financial Corp. and the operating results and phase-out costs of the Shugart operations.

title: Quotation of the Day
description: ''If the will of the Filipino people is expressed in an election that Filipinos accept as credible - and if whoever is elected undertakes fundamental economic, political and military reforms - we should consider, in consultation with the Congress, a significantly larger program of economic and military assistance for the Philippines for the next five years.'' - President Reagan. [ A1:2. ]

title: 2 Win Hammer Prize For Cancer Research
description: The chief of surgery at the National Cancer Institute and a researcher who found how to mass produce a tumor-killing drug received the 1985 Hammer Prize for cancer research today.

title: NEW STUDY URGED ON SPACE PROGRAM
description: The White House is giving ''serious consideration'' to establishing an independent group to examine the future of the space program, senior White House officials said today.

OWENS-ILLINOIS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31

SOUVENIR HUNTERS WARNED OF TOXIC SHUTTLE DEBRIS
description: Space agency and Coast Guard officials have issued warnings that souvenir hunters face severe burns or death if they should happen to touch some of the debris from the space shuttle Challenger washing ashore from the Atlantic Ocean.

title: DEFENSE LAWYER AT RETRIAL HIRES AN EX-JUROR FOR HER INSIGHTS
description: After a rape trial here ended with a deadlocked jury, a defense attorney hired one of the former jurors to sit through the retrial as a consultant.

title: Nixon Is Home From Hospital
description: Former President Richard M. Nixon, suffering from a severe viral infection and dehydration, has returned home from a Miami hospital and canceled all appointments for the next two weeks, his spokesman said today.

title: Why Excuse Judges From Social Security?
description: To the Editor:

title: PACT HAS RISE IN CO-OP CITY FEES
description: Carrying charges for apartments in the nation's biggest housing development, Co-op City, would rise more than 40 percent over five years, under a complex deal announced today by Governor Cuomo.

title: ORIOLES APPROVE DRUG-TESTING PLAN
description: The Baltimore Orioles, expressing concern over baseball's tarnished image, announced today the formation of the game's first voluntary drug-testing program.

title: Leif Erickson Is Dead; A Movie and TV Actor
description: Leif Erickson, a stage, movie and television actor perhaps best known for his role in the television series ''High Chaparral,'' died of cancer Wednesday at Baptist Hospital here. He was 74 years old and lived in Pensacola and in Malibu, Calif.

title: EXPOSAIC INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Taiwan Spurs Imports
description: Taiwan has lifted import restrictions on 62 products in an effort to reduce its lion last year, the Board of Foreign Trade said today. Medicine, caviar and telecommunications equipment may now be freely imported.

title: AFFILIATED BANK CORP OF WYOMING reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: POST-VOTE REPRISALS FEARED IN MANILA
description: Apprehension is growing that there will be unrest and reprisals after the presidential election next week, and many people, particularly those who oppose President Ferdinand E. Marcos, say they are making contingency plans for themselves and their families.

title: POP AND JAZZ GUIDE
description: Larry Adler, a master of the instrument that he chooses to call the mouth organ (others may say harmonica), is bringing three key figures in his long and celebrated career to perform with him tonight and tomorrow at the Ballroom, 253 West 28th Street (244-3005). One is the tap- dancer Paul Draper, with whom Mr. Adler toured with great success 40 years ago when he played and Mr. Draper danced to classical music, jazz and Broadway tunes. The partnership was broken up in 1948 when Mr. Adler was blacklisted for refusing to identify friends as Communists. This is their first formal appearance together since then.

title: Mob Trial Defendant Cleared by U.S. Judge
description: A Federal judge dismissed all charges yesterday against one of nine men, said to be associates of the late Paul Castellano, who are charged with murder conspiracy and operating an international car theft ring.

title: KISSINGER SAYS HE MAY OPPOSE CUOMO IN FALL
description: Henry A. Kissinger said yesterday that New York Republican leaders had urged him to run for governor and that he was considering such a candidacy against Governor Cuomo.

title: Right-to-Work Sees a Right-to-Complain
description: Five years ago, any reasonable scenario for the Reagan Presidency would have cast the National Right to Work Committee as an ally of the new Administration. Like other conservative organizations, the committee, whose main mission is lobbying to reduce the power of unions, was expected to get a lift from a President not known in recent years for being an ardent supporter of organized labor.

title: CAREERCOM CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BARTON VALVE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Advertising; Shearson Is First Client For Two New Firms
description: American Express held a press conference yesterday to report that its Shearson Lehman Brothers brokerage firm would be splitting its $20 million advertising account between Ira Madris, Bruce Nelson & Colleagues, which will handle creative and advertising production, and Media Placement Services, which will buy the media. Shearson happens to be the first client for both firms.

title: Philadelphia Adds ECU's
description: The Philadelphia Stock Exchange, after more than a month's delay, received Government approval today to be the first United States exchange to trade options on European Currency Units, or ECU's. The Philadelphia exchange announced that trading would begin Feb. 12.

title: Norwest Units
description: The Norwest Corporation said it had agreed to sell eight of its banks in southern Minnesota and seven branch offices in South Dakota to various buyers. The combined assets of the 15 locations totaled $326 million as of year-end 1985, less than 1.6 percent of the company's total assets, Norwest said. Lloyd P. Johnson, chairman of Norwest, said, ''We concluded that we simply have more banks than we need in these areas.''

title: Hiding-and-Seeking the Official Budget
description: This year, says the Reagan Administration, it is going to be different. The President's budget for the fiscal year 1987 is not going to be disclosed in newspapers or on radio or television before it is formally unveiled next Wednesday.

title: UNIVERSITY NATIONAL BANK & TRUST CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
GUIDES OFFERED ON GENE-SPLICE PRODUCTS
description: A panel of leading scientists proposed the first uniform guidelines today for protecting the public and the environment against the potential dangers of genetically altered farm chemicals and other products of the infant industry of biotechnology.

title: CHELSEA INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Philadelphia Hearing Set On Plan to Close Hotel
description: A Common Pleas Court judge issued a temporary restraining order Wednesday against owners of the Bellevue Stratford Hotel, who had planned to close the hotel Sunday.

title: BOOKS OF THE TIMES
description: FAMILY AND NATION: The Godkin Lectures, Harvard University. By Daniel Patrick Moynihan. 207 pages. Harcourt Brace Jovanovich. $12.95. FOR three decades, Daniel Patrick Moynihan has played a singular part in public life, combining the roles of politician and social scientist. But Mr. Moynihan would be the first to concede that this wedding of power and knowledge has not lived up to the Platonic ideal.

title: Phelps Dodge
description: The Sumitomo Metal Mining Company said it and the Sumitomo Corporation had agreed to invest $75 million in the Phelps Dodge Corporation's Morenci copper mine in Arizona. The deal will be signed in February, a Phelps Dodge spokesman said. Sumitomo Metal Mining will invest $50 million and the Sumitomo Corporation $25 million.

title: QUAKER STATE OIL REFINING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: JUDGE'S TRIAL HEARS OF AN INVESTMENT FOR INFLUENCE
description: Wiley Fairchild, a wealthy Mississippi businessman, testified today that he included Federal District Judge Walter L. Nixon Jr. in an investment in oil and natural gas wells so he could use the judge's influence later.

title: AVERY INTERNATIONAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
NASSAU SMOKING CURBS TAKE EFFECT TOMORROW
description: Anti-smoking regulations considered among the most restrictive in the United States go into effect Saturday in Nassau County.

title: Transactions
description: BASEBALL MILWAUKEE (AL) - Signed Bill Wegman, Chuck Porter and Juan Nieves, pitchers.

title: UNITED STATES DESIGN CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
NASA Delaying the Selection Of Journalist to Ride Shuttle
description: In the wake of the shuttle disaster Tuesday, officials of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration have halted the process of selecting the first journalist to ride into orbit.

title: HAITI CLOSES AIRPORT IN SECOND-LARGEST CITY
description: President Jean-Claude Duvalier ordered the international airport at Cap-Haitien closed until further notice today after anti-Government demonstrations spread in the northern port city and three other towns.

title: Senate Vote Favors Norfolk Conrail Bid
description: The Reagan Administration's plan to sell Conrail, the Government-owned freight railroad, advanced today as its Senate supporters fought off an antitrust measure they called ''a killer amendment.''

title: CHESAPEAKE CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: The latest year and quarter results include Wisconsin Tissue Mills Incorporation and Plainwell Paper Company since their acquisition on July 1, 1985.

title: WOOD AND ARAI TIED FOR LEAD
description: It's called the A.T.&T. Pebble Beach National Pro-Am now because the phone company took over sponsorship this year, but to those on the PGA Tour who struggled through heavy winds and rain today on the courses at Pebble Beach, Cypress Point or Spyglass Hill, the conditions were still typical ''Crosby weather.''

title: Nicaragua Refuses to Offer Assurances on Indian Group
description: The Government announced this evening that it would take no responsibility for the fate of a rebel Miskito Indian leader, Brooklyn Rivera, or that of Russell Means, an American Indian activist who is believed to be traveling with Mr. Rivera in the contested Atlantic Coast region of the country.

title: DIAMOND SHAMROCK OFFSHORE LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
FREIDMAN TO PICK CITY CLERK, DEMOCRATS SAY
description: Stanley M. Friedman, the Bronx Democratic chairman, will pick the new city clerk as part of an agreement between party leaders in Queens and the Bronx, Democratic politicians said yesterday.

title: An Awful Event
description: ''Awful Event,'' read the headline over The New York Times's account of the assassination of Abraham Lincoln. In the 120 years since, no one has devised a simpler, more devastating phrase that could be applied to the explosion of the Challenger, with the nation and the world watching on television.

title: COMMONWEALTH ENERGY SYSEMS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including gains from the sale of a corporate office of $260,000 for the quarter and $1.1 million for the year. c-Including gains from the sale of a corporate office of $260,000 for the quarter and $4.3 million for the year.

title: HONDURAN MILITARY CHIEF SAYS HE IS PLANNING TO STEP DOWN
description: In what appears to be a high-stakes move in an internal army power struggle, the head of the politically powerful Honduran military said today that he would soon resign his post for ''personal reasons.''

title: PANCHO'S MEXICAN BUFFET reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
FOR COLLEGE STUDENTS, JOB HUNTING WITH A TWIST
description: Ninety-three young men and women arrived in Manhattan earlier this week for a full day's work, one they hoped would assure them many more.

title: DRUG SYSTEMS reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 4
description: b-After a nonoperating pretax loss of $2,636,000. c-Net income.

title: Advertising; Romann & Tannenholtz Is Pollio's New Agency
description: Romann & Tannenholtz Advertising has become agency for the Pollio Dairy Products Corporation of Port Washington, L.I., which formerly had its business at Levine, Huntley, Schmidt & Beaver.

title: TIME INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Reflecting a provision of $13 million pre-tax for the estimated costs stemming from staff reductions announced yesterday. c-Including a gain of $.19 a share from the sale of a subsidiary, Pioneer Press Inc.

title: SATOR'S CRITICISM SHAKES RANGERS
description: In the steamy, narrow corridor near the showers, just outside the Ranger coach's office, Mark Pavelich shook his head and pulled at his hair. The coach had just asked to see him. Pavelich looked as though he might cry.

title: ANGOLA'S ECONOMIC STRUGGLES
description: Squatting in the shade of a baobab tree, the market woman wanted 5,000 kwanzas -officially $165 - for her prize possession: a bottle of Russian vodka.

title: RLI CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including investment gains of $78,804, or 2 cents a share, for the quarter and $216,723, or 7 cents a share, for the year. c-Including investment gains of $163,225, or 6 cents a share, for the quarter and $16,933, or 1 cent a share, for the year.

title: Quebec Carnival
description: Champion skaters will be skating, dancers will be dancing and chefs from area restaurants will be creating sculptures made of ice at an event Sunday at Rockefeller Center marking the 32d Quebec Winter Carnival.

title: MEAD CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BROCKWAY INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a gain from the sale of Canadian plastic plant and after an extraordinary charge of $3,768,000 from closing of glass container facilities in Rosemount.

title: WM WRIGLEY JR CO reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
SYRIA PRESERVES A GOLAN GHOST TOWN
description: In speeches, radio broadcasts and newspaper editorials, Syrian officials still wage a war of words with Israel over its 19-year occupation of the Golan Heights, 40 miles from Damascus.

title: BRIEFS
description: American Motors Corp. said it had extended its low-interest financing and cash-rebate program on its Renault Alliance and Encore subcompact cars through the end of February.

title: SOUL MUSIC: JAMES BROWN IN CONCERT
description: JAMES BROWN, the so-called ''godfather of soul,'' has hit a new peak late in his career.

title: Players' Grievance Is Set
description: Donald Fehr, executive director of the Major League Baseball Players Association, said yesterday that the union would file a grievance today or Monday, charging the owners with violating the collective bargaining agreement by acting in collusion regarding the signing of free agents during the offseason.

title: BANKS JOSTLE FOR L.I. BUSINESS
description: Sometime soon, close to a hundred employees of Chemical Bank, from lending officers to branch managers to investment experts, will meet at the crack of dawn at the bank's Long Island offices here. Then they will fan out to sign up as many high-technology companies as possible as Chemical customers.

title: LEGAL SHIFT IS SOUGHT BY F.C.C.
description: The Federal Communications Commission proposed today a 24-point legislative package that calls for sweeping changes in Federal communications law, including doing away with the fairness, equal-time and reasonable-access requirements for broadcasters.

title: SCREEN: 'POWER,' BY SIDNEY LUMET
