description: ''POWER,'' Sidney Lumet's new film about the selling of political candidates, fearlessly exposes the whole rotten world of ''media consultants,'' those cold, heartless manipulators of public opinion for the private advantage of clients who pay the bills.

title: WINNER IN UGANDA
description: When Yoweri Museveni was sworn in Wednesday as President of Uganda, viewing the ceremony on the steps of Parliament were scores of children who had served as his soldiers.

title: CONTINENTAL TELECOM INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Year-ago results restated to reflect pooling of interest acquisitions and other reclassifications.

title: BOLT TECHNOLOGY CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income.

title: THE EVENING HOURS
description: TO whom do orchestra conductors tell conductor jokes? To other conductors, of course, said John Mauceri, music director of the American Symphony Orchestra, at the Leopold Stokowski Conducting Competition in Avery Fisher Hall on Wednesday. Clearly, among the 600 guests at the cocktail party that preceded the finals of the contest and the dinner after, there were more than enough conductors as well as other music cognoscenti to appreciate Mr. Mauceri's story about Leonard Bernstein imitating Herbert von Karajan imitating Sir Thomas Beecham.

title: WESTERN MICROWAVE LABORATORIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 29
U.S. IS SAID TO INVESTIGATE MANE'S LINKS TO GRAND PRIX EFFORT
description: The United States Attorney in Brooklyn is investigating connections between Donald R. Manes, the Queens Borough President, and a hard-fought effort to create a Grand Prix race track in Flushing Meadows, investigative officials said yesterday.

title: Dining Out Guide: Upper East Side, Below 79th Street
description: Following is a summary of reviews of restaurants that have appeared in The New York Times. Stars are followed by the date of original publication. Prices are current, and only weekend hours are given. ALO ALO, #1030 Third Avenue, at 61st

title: Diner's Journal
description: OYSTER stew, oysters with ham and parsley, poached oysters with beurre blanc, oatmeal-coated deep-fried oysters, risotto with oysters - these and more are being offered during a special oyster celebration at Union Square Cafe now through the height of the harvest season in late February. The restaurant is also serving a variety of oysters on the half shell with black bread, butter and two sauces: mignonette and tomato-horseradish.

title: BUSINESS DIGEST: FRIDAY, JANUARY 31, 1986
description: The Economy

title: Time Out From Scandal
description: While scandal swirled around the city government, the United States Attorney in Manhattan, Rudolph W. Giuliani, had other matters on his mind.

title: Mubarak Starts Talks With Officials in Bonn
description: President Hosni Mubarak of Egypt held talks with West German officials today, starting a two-day visit that is expected to center on his attempt to involve the Western European powers in the Middle East peace process.

title: ART THAT EVOKES KUROSAWA
description: AS of a day or two ago, I have a short list of titles that would cause me to step right up to the box office if they were to come up in lights on the marquee of a movie house. One of them - rich in salty promise - is ''The Brine Maidens.'' Others, varied in all save their power to tantalize, are ''The Success Story of a Mouse,'' ''The Poetry Match of the 36 Immortal Poets'' and ''The Giant Drunkard of Oeyama.''

title: U.S. AIDES SEE CHANCE OF PACT ON AVOIDING WAR IN EUROPE
description: Eastern bloc and Western nations may be close to an agreement at the Stockholm conference on ways to reduce the risk of war in Europe, American officials say.

title: ETHICS CHIEF SAYS PANEL WILL CONSIDER PROPOSALS
description: The chairman of New York City's Board of Ethics said yesterday that the board was preparing to study Mayor Koch's request to adopt rules that would bar some political officials from doing business with the city.

title: MCGRAW-HILL RYERSON LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
LEADING INDICATORS RISE HEFTY 0.9%
description: The Government's main economic forecasting gauge rose a hefty nine-tenths of 1 percent in December, its eighth consecutive monthly gain, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: UNITED FINANCIAL BANKING COS INC reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
CENTOCOR INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including tax credits of $380,676 for the quarter and $1,462,358 for the year. c-Including tax credits of $154,573 for the quarter and $303,464 for the year.

title: BEVERLY ENTERPRISES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Small Art on View
description: An exhibition of more than 200 artworks measuring 12 inches or less will be on display tomorrow at 80 Washington Square East Galleries, 566 La Guardia Place, near West Third Street.

title: Space Center Sets Up Mental Health Team
description: Houston, Jan. 30 (UPI) - A special team of psychiatrists has been created to help National Aeronautic and Space Administration workers cope with the trauma of the space shuttle explosion.

title: XEROX HAD PROFIT IN 4TH QUARTER
description: The Xerox Corporation, garnering a $42 million gain from the sale of its last publishing company, yesterday reported fourth-quarter earnings of $156 million, or $1.49 a share.

title: A SCIENCE SHOW THAT BRINGS BACK THE WONDER
description: IF New York's glow seems dimmer to some of us than it did a few decades ago, one reason is that our wonderful science museum was allowed to die.

title: EL POLLO ASADO CO reports earnings for Qtr to Jan 5
Sri Lanka Rebels Report Killing 16 Soldiers
description: Government troops attacked Tamil separatist guerrillas in the north of Sri Lanka, setting off a battle that left 16 army troops dead, a Tamil rebel group said today.

title: KROGER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
POLICE CHIEF IN RIFT WITH HER OFFICERS
description: This city's Mayor and Police Chief are embroiled in a dispute with the police union over the quality of law enforcement.

title: Economic Scene; New U.S. View On Currencies
description: IN his coming State of the Union address, scheduled for next Tuesday after being postponed because of the space shuttle disaster, President Reagan will direct Treasury Secretary James A. Baker 3d to make a study of ways to improve the international monetary system.

title: CHILI'S INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
THE SCREEN: BEVERLY HILLS GOTHIC
description: THE house is peach-colored, inside and out, and it has everything: potted trees big enough for a rain forest, a burglar alarm system that summons a veritable SWAT team, even his-and-hers pastel refrigerators in the peach-colored boudoir. On the wall hangs an expensive and flattering portrait of the owners, who look a good deal worse in the bed below. In fact, David (Richard Dreyfuss) and Barbara (Bette Midler) Whiteman are only nominally the heads of this household. They don't run it, it runs them. And everyone within their domain -sexually confused son (Evan Richards), anorectic daughter (Tracy Nelson), sultry maid (Elizabeth Pena) - is showing signs of strain. Life here isn't easy, not even for the family dog.

title: Lamb for the Homeless
description: A shipment of 70,000 pounds of frozen New Zealand lamb is to arrive at Food for Survival in the Bronx in the next few days. The organization distributes food to more than 300 programs in the five boroughs.

title: NEW ORLEANS PREPARING TO SELECT A NEW MAYOR
description: With Super Bowl mania exhausted and Mardi Gras less than two weeks away, New Orleans settled down this week to choose a new Mayor, a successor to Ernest N. Dutch Morial, who became the city's first black Mayor eight years ago. The nonpartisan primary election will be held Saturday, and there will be a runoff March 1 if no one wins a majority. The winner takes office May 1.

title: MAYOR'S SESSION GETS NO QUERIES ON MANES CASE
description: Mayor Koch went to Queens last night for the first time since a lawyer linked its Borough President, Donald R. Manes to a municipal bribery scandal. And from the beginning of the Mayor's Town Hall meeting to its end 90 minutes later, he fielded questions about everything but Mr. Manes.

title: SHUTTLE EXPERTS SEARCH FOR CONTINGENCY PLANS
description: Government experts have begun a range of studies to determine whether the three remaining space shuttles can be operated at a pace rapid enough to handle most of the launchings needed in the next few years.

title: GULF STATES UTILITIES CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
RESTAURANTS
description: JOSEPH BAUM might be called New York's gastronomic Vivaldi, orchestrator of the world's second most famous ''Four Seasons,'' and the man who brought respectability to rooftop dining (Windows on the World). His much-anticipated new creation, Aurora, is, as expected, provocative and controversial.

title: Money Fund Assets Off
description: Assets of the nation's money market mutual funds fell $742.5 million, to $212.20 billion, for the week ended Wednesday, the Investment Company Institute said yesterday.

title: ART: CHANGING 'NIAGARA,' AT HISTORICAL SOCIETY
description: NIAGARA FALLS 180 times - on canvas, paper, board and, in one instance, a three-inch-square copper plate. If you count the dishes imprinted with the spectacle, the souvenirs of it, the guides to it and the advertisements for it, the total rises to 248 - all there for the viewing at the New-York Historical Society, 170 Central Park West, between 76th and 77th Streets.

title: AMERICAN SAVINGS BANK OF NY reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including tax credits of $3,013,000 for the quarter and $5,013,000 for the year. c-Net losses. d-Including a gain of $1,776,000 for the quarter and year. The company went public Nov. 27, 1985.

title: 'Help Wanted: Kids' On 'Disney Sunday Movie'
description: For those who demand likelihood and logic as elements of even lightweight comedy, the return this weekend of weekly Disney entertainment on television with ''The Disney Sunday Movie'' on ABC, between 7 P.M. and 9 P.M., is not auspicious.

title: SCREEN: 'EDITH'S DIARY,' AT THE PUBLIC
description: EDITH (Angela Winkler) deals with the awful truth of her middle-class life by retreating to her diary, in which she creates a fantasy world where everything comes out right. After her possibly psychotic teen-age son, Chris (Leopold von Verschuer), almost murders the family cat, she writes, to reassure herself, that ''Chris has finally gotten over his dislike for the cat.'' Later on, when he's dealing drugs, she has him off winning honors at the university.

title: TORCHMARK CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a capital loss of $3,576,000 in the quarter and a capital gain of $2,274,000 in the year. c-After a capital loss of $36,376,000 in the quarter and a capital loss of $36,366,000 in the year.

title: AVON PRODUCTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including gains from discontinued operations of $11.1 million for the quarter and $34.9 million for the year and after losses on disposal of discontinued operations of $223 million for the quarter and year. c-Net income. d-Including gains from discontinued operations of $9.5 million for the quarter and $29.8 million for the year.

title: MUSIC: FINE ARTS QUARTET
description: THE Fine Arts Quartet is one of those ensembles that date back so many years, none of the original members are still active. The current lineup -Ralph Evans and Efim Boico, violins; Jerry Horner, viola, and Wolfgang Laufer, cello - journeyed from the University of Wisconsin, Milwaukee, to New York for a Wednesday evening concert at the 92d Street Y. Mr. Evans is an unusually assertive first violinist; he leads the group with a sound that is driving, intense and sweet, despite some wavery intonation.

title: Hartman to Resign
description: Jack Hartman, who missed his team's last 15 games last season after suffering a heart attack and had quadruple bypass surgery before coming back, announced last night that he would step down as basketball head coach of Kansas State after 16 years, effective at the end of the school year. ''I'm a guy who's 60 years old and has been coaching for about 50 of them,'' he said.

title: FUROR ON CONVENT NEAR AUSCHWITZ
description: The establishment of a Roman Catholic convent near the site of the Auschwitz death camp has caused dismay among some Jewish groups in the United States and Western Europe who call it an affront to the memory of the Jews who were killed there by the Nazis.

title: NAPA VALLEY BANCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Pultz Regains Title
description: Boone Pultz, who lost the United States Boxing Association cruiserweight championship in a 12-round split decision to Stanley Ross in Washington in December, has regained his title after a second drug test confirmed that Ross had marijuana in his system at the time of the fight. After receiving results of the second test, the U.S.B.A. executive committee declared the December bout a ''no decision'' fight and restored the title to Pultz.

title: SHELLS HIT GEMAYEL RESIDENCE
description: Artillery duels raged between rival factions here today, and shells struck the presidential palace in a Christian suburb of Beirut and the campus of the American University of Beirut in the Moslem sector of the capital.

title: U.S. GAIN IS FOUND IN HEALTH REPORT
description: Americans are healthier and living longer but are also paying steeply for it, the Government said Wednesday in its annual report on the nation's health.

title: Something Is Rotten In the Oil Burner
description: To the Editor:

title: YANKEES SEEK HASSEY AGAIN
description: In what would be one of the more intriguing moves of the off-season, the Yankees are trying to reacquire Ron Hassey from the White Sox after trading him to Chicago last month.

title: Aguilera Signs
description: The Mets have signed Rick Aguilera to a one-year contract for about $110,000.

title: Northwest Air
description: Northwest Airlines and Republic Airlines are asking Federal officials to speed approval of Northwest's $884 million deal to buy Republic, saying an expedited purchase would benefit air travelers and employees. The airlines asked the Transportation Department to provide an exemption from the usual 6- to 12-month hearing process. The airlines asked for approval by mid-April, the start of the peak travel season.

title: AMERICA WEST AIRLINES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net losses.

title: Fond Memories Of a Trusted Aide
description: Forty years of New York politics and government were represented at the Vivian Beaumont Theater yesterday, at a memorial service for Harry J. O'Donnell.

title: The U.N. Today; Jan. 31, 1986
description: GENERAL ASSEMBLY Committee on Non-Use of Force -10:30 A.M. and 3 P.M. ECONOMIC AND

title: VEECO INSTRUMENTS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
'PIZZA' WITNESS ADMITS TO 13 KILLINGS
description: A prosecution witness told the jury in the ''pizza connection'' trial yesterday that he had committed 13 murders, saying that he was just doing his job.

title: 2 City Officers Robbed on L.I.
description: Two probationary New York City police officers were robbed today at a fast food restaurant here. Both were injured in a clash with the robbers.

title: CRANSTON'S FOES COME TO HIS RESCUE
description: With the indictment of Representative Bobbi Fiedler, the trading of charges of political manipulation and dirty tricks has blanketed southern California like smog over the past few days. But political analysts are saying that when the smog clears, standing with Mrs. Fiedler among the wounded will be Ed Davis, the State Senator who accused her of trying to bribe him, and perhaps a few others.

title: BEMIS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Minnesota Site For '91 U.S. Open
description: The Hazeltine Golf Club at Chaska, Minn., will be the site of the 1991 United States Open golf championship, the United States Golf Association announced today.

title: ABOUT 100 AMERICANS, SOME RELUCTANT, QUIT LIBYA
description: About 100 Americans left Libya today in the largest departure from the Libyan capital since President Reagan ordered American citizens and residents to leave the country by Feb. 1.

title: Hormel Plant Reports It's Near Full Production
description: The flagship plant of Geo. A. Hormel & Company, idled by a five-month-old strike, said today that it expected to have 750 meatpackers on the job by Friday. That is about three-fourths of the number needed to resume full production, company officials said.

title: ECONOMISTS AWAIT BOTTOM OF CURVE
description: Yesterday's merchandise trade figures were no surprise for many of the nation's economists. The tendency for a nation's trade balance to get worse before it gets better when its currency declines is a well-known economic phenomenon.

title: NASA'S INQUIRY BEGINS: STATUS IS NOT DISCLOSED
description: While major portions of the space shuttle Challenger were recovered from the Atlantic Ocean today, investigators met to study the meager evidence relating to the explosion that destroyed the spaceship and its crew of seven.

title: American Can Gains
description: The American Can Company said its fourth-quarter profit rose 19 percent, to $40.3 million, or $1.36 a share, from $33.8 million, or $1.14 a share, a year earlier.

title: Orphaned Boy Is Center Of 2d Custody Fight
description: A 7-year-old boy whose father killed his mother after a bitter custody fight is once again the center of a legal dispute, with his grandparents seeking to prevent another relative from gaining permanent guardianship.

title: AMSTED INDUSTRIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
NO AID OFFER SEEN AS REAGAN MEETS ANGOLA REBEL
description: President Reagan met today with Jonas Savimbi, whose South African-backed forces are fighting the Soviet-backed Angolan Government, and said the United States wanted to find the best way ''to be very helpful'' to his cause.

title: WESTMORELAND COAL CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net losses after a writeoff of assets of $57.5 million.

title: FRIDAY SPORTS
description: Basketball Knicks vs. Suns, at Phoenix, 9:30 P.M. (Television - MSG, 9:30 P.M. Radio - WNBC, 660; 9:20 P.M.). Los Angeles Lakers vs.

title: Zellerbach Net Climbs by 66%
description: The Crown Zellerbach Corporation said yesterday that it earned $17.1 million, or 48 cents a share, up 66 percent from $10.3 million, or 23 cents a share, a year ago. Sales for the quarter fell 7.8 percent, to $742.8 million, from $805.5 million a year ago.

title: OTTAWA IS SHAKEN BY A NEW DISPUTE
description: Canada's Progressive Conservative Government found itself under attack today for a 13-year-old admission by Erik Nielsen, now the Deputy Prime Minister, that the Conservatives eavesdropped on weekly caucus meetings of Liberal Party legislators in Parliament in the 1960's.

title: Bridge: The Death of Jim Sharples Ends Longtime Partnership
description: What is believed to be the world's longest-lived regular partnership came to an end recently when Jim Sharples died in England at the age of 77.

title: Konishiroku Deal
description: The Konishiroku Photo Industry has completed its purchase of Royal Business Machines Inc., the companies have announced.

title: FRAUD INQUIRY DISRUPTS BELGIAN DIAMOND CENTER
description: Diamond traders in Antwerp and the judicial authorities in Brussels are locked in a battle over purported black-market transactions, casting a cloud over the future of this tight-knit diamond community.

title: Travels With Kemp
description: Representative Jack F. Kemp, the New York Republican aiming for his party's 1988 Presidential nomination, takes off tonight on a two-week European tour in which his staff says he will meet with ''goverment officials at the highest level'' in West Germany, France and Britain, as well as visiting Switzerland. As President Reagan includes international currency revision in his State of the Union Message next Tuesday, Mr. Kemp will expand on the same theme in a speech in Stuttgart. He will also discuss international security and economic issues in speeches in Paris and London.

title: SYSTEMS ASSURANCE CORP reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-After a writeoff of goodwill amounting to $1,301,627.

title: Ethiopia's Trail of Tears
description: Ethiopia is uprooting about 1.5 million people in what its Marxist regime calls a ''voluntary'' resettlement program. But a reputable French-based relief agency, Doctors Without Borders, insists otherwise. It says villagers in the northern highlands are being trucked to infested southern wetlands in a forced migration and estimates that 100,000 lives have been lost. Ethiopia says the charges are ''without foundation'' and asserts that United Nations observers dispute the casualty estimates.

title: CENTRAL ILLINOIS PUBLIC SERVICE CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a gain of $20,032,000 from an accounting change.

title: PATRIOT MOVE DISTURBS UNION
description: The disclosure of the names of six New England Patriots said to have used drugs could inhibit other National Football League players who use drugs from coming forth to seek help, the leader of the players' association said yesterday.

title: AMERICAN FEDERAL SAVINGS & LOAN ASSN (COLO)(O) reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
SPANISH PRINCE, 18, SWORN IN AS THE HEIR APPARENT
description: Prince Felipe of Spain came of age today, swearing allegiance to King and Constitution in a ceremony officially making him heir to the throne.

title: Schools Plan Silent Tribute
description: A moment of silence will be observed today in all public schools in New York City at 10 A.M. in memory of the seven astronauts who died when the space shuttle Challenger exploded Tuesday, according to an announcement by the Schools Chancellor, Nathan Quinones, and the president of the Board of Education, James F. Regan.

title: WASHINGTON WATER POWER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
NEWS SUMMARY:FRIDAY, JANUARY 31, 1986
description: The Shuttle Inquiry

title: SEEKING ELECTION? COME SHAKE THE MONEY TREE
description: How many candidates for the United States Senate this year would dare to make this covenant with voters: ''I pledge today that, if elected, the Federal deficit, the trade deficit and real interest rates will be brought under control or I will not seek re-election in 1992''?

title: AUSTRON INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
JUDGES' DEFERRAL OF SENTENCINGS PROMPTS DEBATE
description: Officials of the city's Probation Department argued yesterday that judges had no right to place criminals under the supervision of probation officers between conviction and sentencing.

title: Apocalypse Exhibition
description: The Apocalypse, the biblical vision of doomsday, is the subject of an exhibition of manuscripts and illustrations from the 10th to 18th centuries on view through April 13 at the Pierpont Morgan Library, 29 East 36th Street.

title: BUFFTON CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
M.I.S.L. All-Stars
description: The Major Indoor Soccer League, announcing the first selections for the league's all-star game in Chicago Feb. 18., managed to avoid any major surprises.

title: EX-OFFICIAL SAYS CITY AIDES FEAR TO AIR MISDEEDS
description: A former high-ranking city personnel official told a State Senate committee yesterday that many city employees ''live in terror'' that they will lose their jobs if they report mismanagement and corruption in city government.

title: E.P.A. Official Warns Of Passive Smoke Peril
description: A Federal health safety official said Wednesday that it was time to stop dismissing nonsmokers as ''finicky busybodies'' when they complained about inhaling other people's smoke.

title: MINNESOTA WINS WITH NEW LINEUP
description: Ray Gaffney, a seldom-used freshman until Minnesota's basketball program was jeopardized by criminal charges against three players last week, scored 17 points in his first start tonight, lifting the Gophers to a startling 70-65 Big Ten victory over Ohio State.

title: SCOTT PAPER CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a gain of $.19 a share on the repurchase of stock held by Brascan Ltd.

title: FINANCE/NEW ISSUES;
description: Countrywide Mortgage Obligations is offering $103.5 million of collateralized mortgage obligations backed by a pool of Federal National Mortgage Association pass-through securities through underwriters led by Paine Webber Inc.

title: Four Palestinians Are Seized In Death of Israeli Policeman
description: An Israeli policeman was shot dead today outside the entrance to Jerusalem's Arab quarter and four Palestinians were arrested, the police reported.

title: CLUB MED INC reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
BECOR WESTERN INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
SONICS HOLD NETS TO SEASON LOW
description: The Seattle SuperSonics, with one victory in their last eight games, a 3-20 record on the road and the fourth-worst overall mark in the National Basketball Association, are not supposed to beat teams like the Nets, especially in New Jersey.

title: A DAY OF GRIEF AND PRAISE FOR MCAULIFFE
description: The parents of Christa McAuliffe emerged briefly from seclusion this afternoon to attend a memorial service here, where Gov. Michael S. Dukakis said that their daughter, who was to have been the first teacher in space, would now be ''the inspiration for hundreds of thousands of young people in this country.''

title: MYLAN LABORATORIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
REPAIRS FORCING DINERS TO YIELD TO LAWMAKERS
description: Trenton may have the only cafeteria in the country where the patronage will increase now that the steam tables have been closed down.

title: NEWSPAPER EXECUTIVE FACES DAY HE HAD LONG DREADED
description: H. Harrison Cochran, president of a group of suburban weekly newspapers, knew that eventually someone would write about the day in 1965 when he was 18 years old and shot his mother, father and sister to death at their home in Wilmette, Ill.

title: PRECISION CASTPARTS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
PUROLATOR COURIER reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net income. Non-recurring costs of $9 million before taxes were recorded in the fourth quarter.

title: OGILVY GROUP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
What's Good About the Nuclear Liability Law
description: To the Editor:

title: PPG-Swedlow
description: The Federal Trade Commission said it was challenging PPG Industries' proposed $41.8 million acquisition of Swedlow Inc. The commission charged that a PPG takeover of Swedlow would substantially reduce competition in the manufacture and sale of windows, windshields and canopies used in aircraft.

title: FIRST FINANCIAL MANAGEMENT reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Share earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split paid in June 1985.

title: U.S.-Soviet Air Control Link In the Pacific Due in August
description: A United States-Soviet air control link that should help prevent another North Pacific air disaster like that of the South Korean plane in 1983 is scheduled to be in operation by late August, officials said today.

title: TAX DIVERSITY: MANHATTAN VS. BROOKLYN
description: It is easy for Victor Gartenstein to describe the site of his new development project to residents of the Bay Ridge section of Brooklyn. ''It's across the street from the Tiffany Diner,'' he says. The Tiffany is as well known in Bay Ridge as the Empire Diner is in the Chelsea district of Manhattan.

title: INEXCO OIL CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a net writedown of operating assets of $49.1 million for the quarter and year. c-After a net writedown of $27 million for the quarter and year.

title: Leucadia Raises Stake in GATX
description: The Leucadia National Corporation said it had raised its stake in the GATX Corporation from 5.2 percent to the equivalent of 6.3 percent of the shares outstanding. In a filing with the Securities and Exchange Commission, Leucadia said it is considering acquiring some GATX assets and has entered into a standstill agreement with GATX in order to receive confidential information from the Chicago-based rail car leasing and shipping company.

title: DIGILOG INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a net loss from discontinued operations of $908,000.

title: MEASURE TO RELAX GUN RULES DENOUNCED BY POLICE GROUPS
description: A coalition of 10 national police organizations and the New York City Police Commisioner said today that proposed legislation to relax gun controls, already approved by the Senate, posed ''an immediate and unwarranted threat to the law-enforcement community.''

title: Jury Recommends 30-Year Sentence
description: An Essex County jury today recommended that a 31-year-old cabdriver serve at least 30 years in prison for sexually assaulting and murdering a Montclair woman in 1983. The jury recommended against the death penalty.

title: The Challenge Beyond Challenger
description: Far from turning the public against the space program, the loss of the shuttle Challenger appears to have revived interest and enthusiasm. While NASA puzzles out what went wrong, President Reagan and Congress have a fine chance to rethink the space program and clarify the agency's goals.

title: Yeutter Urges Weaker Dollar
description: A further decline of at least 15 percent in the dollar's value is necessary to substantially reduce the trade deficit, the Reagan Administration's trade representative, Clayton K. Yeutter, said today.

title: AT THE MOVIES
description: THE idea for the American Academy of Dramatic Arts' tribute to Spencer Tracy, which will be held on March 3 at the Majestic Theater, dates back three years, to when the academy's representatives first asked Katharine Hepburn if she would be interested in helping arrange an evening in honor of her longtime screen partner, who was one of its most famous alumni (Mr. Tracy was in the class of 1923).

title: CYPRUS PORT, AGAINST THE ODDS, IS BOOMING
description: Overcoming its own misfortunes and benefiting from those of a neighbor, this southern port city is enjoying a seemingly unending boom.

title: BETZ LABORATORIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
DIAMOND CRYSTAL SALT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
LODGISTIX INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including tax credits of $60,000 for the quarter and $191,000 for the 6 months.

title: What's Good About the Nuclear Liability Law
description: To the Editor:

title: Norton Charge
description: The Norton Company said its board had approved a restructuring that will result in a $167.5 million after-tax charge against fourth-quarter earnings. The charge approved by the board is higher than the company's preliminary estimate of $110 million to $120 million issued last October. The company said the increase resulted from the adverse outlook on energy prices, some additional costs involving the abrasives group and an increase in the expected cost of reducing salaried staff.

title: SYSTEM INTEGRATORS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Securities Prices Up Slightly
description: Prices of Government securities closed slightly higher yesterday. But dealers said the modest price changes did not fully reflect the heavy and at times intense trading throughout the session. Much of the volume consisted of switching maturities rather than reactions to the day's economic news, which was largely ignored, several dealers noted.

title: JOAN COLLINS IN 'SINS,' A MINI-SERIES
description: ''SINS'' isn't improbable or unlikely; it's something grander than that: preposterous, say, or absurd. At the same time it's not really about what it's supposed to be about; it's really about Joan Collins and her Valentino clothes. On ''Sins,'' a seven-hour, three-part mini-series, they wear one another. The mini-series begins with a three-hour episode on Sunday at 8 P.M. on CBS.

title: U.S. PROSECUTORS SAY THEY WON'T CHARGE DOWD IN BRIBE CASE
description: The Justice Department has agreed not to bring charges against a Queens lawyer in exchange for testimony implicating Donald R. Manes in a bribery scheme, Federal prosecutors said yesterday.

title: U.S. OIL COMPANIES MAY BE EXEMPTED FROM LIBYA CURBS
description: The Administration is considering granting licenses to American oil companies to let them continue to receive some income from Libya after President Reagan's economic sanctions go into effect Saturday, a senior Administration official said today.

title: THE SCREEN: ROB LOWE STARS AS 'YOUNGBLOOD'
description: DEAN YOUNGBLOOD'S teammates on the Hamilton Mustangs hockey team think he's too pretty, and who can blame them - as played by Rob Lowe, he is. So the other players haze Dean unmercifully, clobbering him on the ice and subjecting him to all manner of unpleasantness in the locker room. After awhile, though, they begin to soften; they come to realize that Dean is a good egg after all. And the audience does, too. ''Youngblood,'' which opens today at Loews Astor Plaza and other theaters, is at its shrewdest in introducing Mr. Lowe in this roundabout way, since he becomes much more sympathetic as an underdog than he might be as a complacent-looking winner.

title: WEEKENDER GUIDE
description: Friday HAPPY BIRTHDAY, FRANZ Franz Schubert will be given a birthday party tonight with a gala concert of chamber music, lieder, and choral works at Symphony Space, Broadway at 95th Street. The three-hour Schubert Birthday Celebration features the pianist Robert Merfeld, the violinist Ruth Waterman and the cellist Bonnie Thron performing the Trio in B flat (D. 898) and -joined by Leslie Tomkins on viola and Richard Hartshorne on double bass -the Quintet in A (''Trout,'' D. 667). Vocal music will be performed by the soprano Dawn Upshaw, accompanied by Mr. Merfeld and by Debra Poole on horn and Charles Neidich on clarinet. The women of the New Amsterdam Singers will also be heard in three works for choral ensemble. The Schubertiad begins at 8 P.M. Tickets are $5. Information: 864-5400.

title: REDLAKE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a $193,392 default of notes receivable by Certus Technologies. c-Net income.

title: ISLANDERS DEFEAT FLYERS BY 8-4
description: Suddenly, the team that a month ago accused itself of inconsistency and underachievement has dedicated itself to giant-killing. Tonight at Nassau Coliseum, the Islanders appeared invincible when they jumped to a 5-0 first-period lead against the Philadelphia Flyers on the way to an 8-4 victory.

title: Union Pacific Names Lewis
description: The Union Pacific Corporation said yesterday that Drew Lewis, a former Transportation Secretary in the Reagan Administration, would become chairman and chief executive of the company's Omaha-based railroad effective April 1.

title: MARCOS CALLS FOE A NAIVE UTOPIAN
description: President Ferdinand E. Marcos contended today that his decree of martial law 13 years ago was akin to the American Constitution in guaranteeing a ''free and open society.''

title: Y Chamber Symphony
description: The recorder player Michala Petri will join Gerard Schwarz and the Y Chamber Symphony for a program of music by Corelli, Vivaldi, Handel and Anton Heberle at the 92d Street Y tomorrow night at 8 o'clock. Tickets are $15 to $20; information: 831-8603.

title: EXECUTIVE CHANGES
description: Columbia Pictures Industries, a subsidiary of the Coca-Cola Co., has named Kenneth S. Williams senior vice president.

title: Oil Prices Are Mixed; Traders Ignore Reports
description: Prices for crude oil and petroleum products posted a mixed record in thin trading yesterday on the world oil market.

title: XTRA CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Indy 500 Entrants
description: The Indianapolis 500 is still four months away, but five cars and three drivers have already entered the 1986 race. Scott Brayton, who holds the one-lap track record of 214.199 miles an hour, was assigned to a car entered by Hemelgarn Racing of Indianapolis, and Kevin Cogan and Emerson Fittipaldi were assigned to cars entered by Patrick Racing of Indianapolis, which also entered two cars whose drivers have not been selected.

title: The Dark Side of Oil-Price Reductions
description: The world is now confronted with an unprecedented decline in oil prices. Lower oil prices are generally expected to lessen inflation, reduce interest rates and improve economic performance worldwide. A free market in oil is held to be established at long last; oil, it is said, thus becomes a commodity like any other.

title: U.S. VOWS RISE IN AID IF MANILA CHANGES POLICY
description: President Reagan said today that the United States would consider ''significantly larger'' economic and military aid for the Philippines if the coming elections were credible and the new Government adopted basic policy changes.

title: CENTERBANC SAVING ASSN reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including extraordinary credits of $108,864 for the quarter and $108,864 for the six months. The six months results are after an extraordinary charge of $164,636 from penalties on pre-payment to Federal Home Loan Bank. c-Including an extraordinary credit of $168,393 from Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation Preferred Stock Dividend .

title: GETTING TOO CLOSE AT GULFSTREAM PARK
description: Horseplayers have been known to suffer broken hearts, broken spirits and broken bankrolls during the stretch runs of races, but Frank Poggial, a Gulfstream Park patron, last Friday found a way to break a leg.

title: Advertising; Accounts
description: Americare, health maintainence organization, to Lowe Marschalk, San Francisco.

title: NEWS GROUPS PROTESTING NASA'S SEIZING FILM
description: Some of the country's largest news organizations are protesting the space agency's impounding of their film of the space shuttle Challenger's launching Tuesday.

title: On the Whisky Trail
description: For nearly four hither-and-thithering years now, the James Joyce Society of Washington has been trying to give away a case of Irish whisky by periodically releasing Joycean clues to its hidden location somewhere in the city. But contestants have been unable to penetrate the mystery, and the prize remains unclaimed.

title: AMERICAN AGGREGATES CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a pretax gain of about $600,000 on real estate transactions.

title: A Touch of Class
description: When Senator Frank H. Murkowski of Alaska brought two Vietnamese children from Hanoi to Washington to reunite them with their parents after seven years, his staff thought a touch of home would make Nguyen Vu Chinh, the 10-year-old boy, and Tran Thanh Quynh Chi, his 9-year-old sister, feel better in a strange and confusing land. So a call went out Monday from Capitol Hill to Germaine's restaurant, whose proprietor is Vietnamese.

title: FIRST FEDERAL SAVINGS BANK (CALIF)(O) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
REEVES COMMUNICATIONS CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss after losses from discontinued operations of $3,577,000 for the quarter and $6,602,000 for the year.

title: Ex-Im Bank's Head Going to U.N. Post
description: William H. Draper 3d said yesterday that he was resigning as president of the Export-Import Bank, to become administrator of the United Nations Development Program in New York.

title: TRANSCO ENERGY CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a one-time charge of $92.1 million for the abandonment of the Great Plains coal gasification project.

title: SCREEN: 'ELIMINATORS'
description: ''WHAT'S this anyway, some kind of comic book?'' asks one of the characters in ''Eliminators,'' after he has joined with a part-man, part-machine called a mandroid, a kung fu expert and a female scientist who knows everything in an effort to find and destroy a mad scientist.

title: VERSE PLAY EVOKES POET'S PAST
description: When the poet Donald Hall tried to turn a prose memoir about his heart's home into a prose play, he ''fiddled and fumbled for months,'' he said. ''It would not move. I could not render speech.'' The dialogue was ''dead.'' Then, without planning to, he started to put it into free verse. And all at once, ''I could hear them talking,'' he said - generations of forebears who had lived all their lives on Eagle Pond Farm in central New Hampshire.

title: CROWN ZELLERBACH CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a pretax restructuring charge of $196.5 million. c-Net income after a pretax charge of $30.1 million representing projected losses on timber contracts.

title: DU PONT CANADA INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After special charges of $46,520,000. c-Net income. The company is listed on Toronto Stock Exchange.

title: ARMY GROUNDS NEW COPTERS AFTER DEFECT IS FOUND
description: The Army has grounded its fleet of 68 AH-64 Apache helicopters after the discovery of cracks in the main rotor blades of 13 of the new attack helicopters, the Pentagon said today.

title: How's That?
description: Horseplayers have forever spoken a language all their own, of course, which probably doesn't help explain the remark of one plunger at Aqueduct the other day as he tore up a batch of losing mutuel tickets and searched for a source of solace: a modest but hot raise from his employer.

title: CINCINNATI MICROWAVE reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
A Tax Ruling For Gulf Oil
description: The United States Tax Court ruled today that the Gulf Oil Corporation was entitled to a foreign tax credit of $243 million that it claimed against its 1975 United States taxes for taxes paid to the Iranian government.

title: SHELL CANADA LTD reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a charge of $35 million for costs related to restructuring, relocating and layoffs. The company is listed on the Montreal and Toronto stock exchanges.

title: Intel Expects Profit in 1986
description: The Intel Corporation does not expect to return to profitability until the second half of 1986, its chairman and chief executive, Gordon E. Moore, said.

title: HOMESTEAD FINANCIAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary gain of $487,000 for the quarter and the year.

title: CAPITOL BANCORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CABOT CORPORATION reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After a loss of $2,610,000 from discontinued operations.

title: Reagan Speech Time Set
description: President Reagan, who postponed his State of the Union Message because of the explosion that destroyed the space shuttle Challenger, will give his speech Tuesday to a joint session of Congress at 8 P.M., Eastern standard time, the White House announced today. The message had been scheduled for 9 P.M. last Tuesday. The speech was rescheduled for 8 P.M. to avoid a conflict with NBC's heavily promoted broadcast of ''Peter the Great,'' a dramatic series that is to begin Tuesday at 9 P.M.

title: YEAR'S TRADE DEFICIT HIT A RECORD $148.5 BILLION
description: Despite a weakening dollar and declining oil prices, the nation's trade deficit grew to a record $148.5 billion for 1985, the Commerce Department reported today.

title: Boeing Venture In Saudi Arabia
description: The Boeing Company has agreed to help build a $100 million aircraft-overhaul center in the Saudi Arabian capital of Riyadh, a company spokesman said.

title: Youth Seized on Berlin Wall
description: East German border guards seized a teen-age boy on Wednesday as he was trying to scale the Berlin wall in a sector facing West Berlin's French sector, the West Berlin police said today.

title: Appeals Court Faults Judge in Gandhi Case
description: Two appeals court judges ruled today that a lower court judge made three technical errors in sentencing three Sikhs to death last week in the murder of Prime Minister Indira Gandhi.

title: VENTREX LABORATORIES INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss.

title: Time Inc. Earnings Fall 22.9%; Layoffs Set for 136
description: Time Inc. said yesterday that its fourth-quarter earnings fell 22.9 percent, largely because of a $13 million pretax charge related to the layoffs of 136 employees in its magazine group and the elimination of 52 jobs through attrition.

title: British Copter Dispute Reignited in Parliament
description: The British Government today barred three officials at the center of the so-called Westland controversy from giving evidence to a parliamentary committee of investigation.

title: TEXT OF REAGAN'S STATEMENT ON ELECTION IN PHILIPPINES
description: Following is the text of a statement today by President Reagan on the Philippine election, as issued by the White House:

title: Don't Build Family Shelters Without Services
description: To the Editor:

title: Pianist, 94, to Play
description: The 94-year-old pianist Mieczyslaw Horszowski will mark the 80th anniversary of his New York debut by playing Mozart's Piano Concerto in D minor (K. 466) with the Orchestra of St. Luke's, under the direction of Leon Fleisher, at the Metropolitan Museum tonight at 8 o'clock. The program will also include music by Mendelssohn and Stravinsky. Tickets are $17; information: 570-3949.

title: NATIONAL DISTILLERS & CHEMICAL CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a gain of $16.7 million from the sale of stock investments for the quarter and year and a gain of $200,000 from discontinued operations for the year. c-After losses from discontinued operations of $6.2 million for the quarter and $24.7 million for the year.

title: NEEDIEST ARE AIDED BY MATCHING FUNDS FROM CORPORATIONS
description: Matching-gift grants and contributions of stock are among the ways in which individuals and businesses are working together to help the 74th annual appeal of The New York Times Neediest Cases Fund.

title: Salvadoran Troops Raid Rebel Forces on Volcano
description: Some 2,000 Government troops began an offensive against leftist guerrillas today on the flanks of a volcano in eastern San Vicente Province, military officials and civilians said.

title: VIRGINIA SHOCKS CAROLINA
description: Olden Polynice led six Virginia players in double figures and the Cavaliers withstood a second-half rally tonight for an 86-73 Atlantic Coast Conference basketball victory over top-ranked and previously undefeated North Carolina.

title: BROADWAY
description: IF it's Sherlock Holmes, it must be a thriller -and it is - but the master sleuth's final foray is something more than twisty detecting and surprising revelations. It's also an exploration of ego and envy and what that really means is anyone's guess because Frank Langella isn't talking, nor are his associates.

title: Chile's Police Rout Doctors
description: The police fired tear-gas grenades and water cannon today to disperse some 200 white-coated doctors demonstrating during a 24-hour strike called by Chile's medical association, witnesses said. Medical association officials said some 90 percent of doctors at state hospitals had stopped work, apart from those manning emergency services, to protest spending levels in the health service and reprisals against association activists by the military Government. Stoppages were also reported in the cities of Punta Arenas and Concepcion.

title: Amsted Agrees To Buyout Bid
description: Amsted Industries said today that it had reached an agreement to be acquired by a group of its management and its employee stock ownership plan in a transaction valued at about $517 million.

title: BLACK HISTORY MONTH: ARRAY OF CELEBRATIONS
description: What began as national Negro History Week in 1926 has now grown to the monthlong Black History celebration held each February. But if all the material being gathered now by historians were to be presented in seminars, lectures, workshops and exhibitions, there would be enough to celebrate black accomplishments throughout the year.

title: AVANT-GARDE JAZZ OF THE 60'S: REBEL TURNED ELDER STATESMAN
description: THEY said avant-garde jazz, or ''free form'' or ''the new music,'' wouldn't last -''they'' always do. But the avant-garde jazz of the 1960's, that initially chaotic-sounding assault on traditional notions of harmony, rhythm and structure, has stayed the course, gone the distance.

title: AFTER 11 YEARS APART, RUSSIAN IS REUNITED WITH AMERICAN HUSBAND
description: After years of struggle with Soviet emigration authorities, Irina McClellan, the Soviet wife of an American professor, arrived in the United States today and was reunited with the husband she had not seen since August 1974.

title: Topics; When the Blood Runs Cold Give Blood, Fight Fear
description: New York blood banks are accustomed to a seasonal lag in donations around Christmas and New Year's, when few groups schedule blood drives. That normal slowdown is worsened this winter by misplaced fears about AIDS.

title: EXECUTIVE IN KEY POST OUT AT ITT
description: The ITT Corporation executive in charge of developing a digital telephone switch for the United States market has resigned from the company in a move that might indicate the curtain is being brought down on the expensive and so far ill-fated project.

title: SEARCHERS REPORT FINDING BIG PIECE OF SPACE SHUTTLE
description: The Coast Guard said today that it had discovered floating at sea what it believed were a large part of the fuselage and items from the cockpit of the space shuttle Challenger, which exploded Tuesday over the Atlantic Ocean, killing all seven crew members.

title: Phone Tie to Shuttle Service
description: A telephone link that has given people worldwide access to communications between space shuttle astronauts and the Johnson Space Center here will carry Friday's memorial service for the Challenger's crew. Dial-A-Shuttle, a service of the National Space Institute, has carried live broadcasts of the last 18 civilian shuttle missions. Callers in the United States can reach the service by dialing (900) 410-6272.

title: LILY-TULIP INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
HOWARD BANCORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Results prior to Dec. 1, 1985 have been restated to include Woodstock National Bank, the acquisition of which was accounted for on a pooling- of-interests basis.

title: VERMONT SHIFTING TO LEFT IN A FLOW OF NEWCOMERS
description: At a time when President Reagan is pressing for a historic political realignment, with the Republicans challenging the Democrats as the majority party for the first time since the Depression, Vermont has been marching the other way.

title: CAVCO INDUSTRIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss after a tax credit of $117,200.

title: AVX CORP reports earnings for Year to Dec 31
description: b-Net income.

title: THE STAGE: STEPPENWOLF IN PINTER'S 'CARETAKER'
description: ALTHOUGH Chicago's Steppenwolf Theater Company has already done a sensational hypothetical version of ''The Caretaker,'' the genuine item has not come to life in the newly arrived production at the Circle in the Square. As it happens, the recent Steppenwolf presentation of ''Orphans'' - a pastiche derivative of ''The Caretaker'' written by Lyle Kessler and directed by Gary Sinise - was far closer in spirit to Harold Pinter's 1960 three-man play than John Malkovich's current staging of the actual Pinter script. What's gone wrong? Just about everything. Stretching to almost three hours -even while failing to fill much more than half of the Circle's arena stage - this ''Caretaker'' honors the pauses in Pinter but little else.

title: Houston Project By Fluor, Crow
description: The Fluor Corporation said it had agreed to a joint venture with the Trammel Crow Company of Texas to build a $380 million office and retail complex in the Houston suburb of Sugar Land. The development plan calls for 1.5 million square feet of office space and 400,000 square feet of retail space to be built during the next 15 years on 160 acres owned by Fluor.

title: Gannett Back In Audit Unit
description: Fourteen Gannett Company newspapers that pulled out of the Audit Bureau of Circulations in a dispute over how circulation figures are calculated will reinstate their memberships, the company said.

title: JORDAN SAYS IT DID NOT SEND INFILTRATOR
description: Jordan has sent Israel an informal message through the United States saying that a gunman who crossed the Jordan River on Wednesday and killed two Israeli soldiers was not sent by Jordan, Israeli officials said today.

title: Rust On the Iron Lady
description: Prime Minister Margaret Thatcher rallied every vote of her Conservative Party's majority in the House of Commons to support her on the peculiar Westland affair that threatened her leadership. But no sooner had she registered her formal victory than virtually everybody started to turn on her. She is evidently no longer popular.

title: 3 Arabs Drop Israeli Suit
description: Three West Bank Arabs suspected of being active in hard-line wings of the Palestine Liberation Organization today dropped their High Court appeal against an order expelling them from Israel. The three men said they were withdrawing the suits because they could not expect a reasonable decision. They are Dr. Azmi Shu'aibi, a dentist; Ali Abu Hilal, a leader of a building workers' union, and Hassan Abdul Jawad, a journalist.

title: FILM: 'BEST OF TIMES,' FOOTBALL STORY
description: THE muddy football game that concludes ''The Best of Times'' is such a rouser that it almost makes up for the incomplete passes and stopped runs that precede it. The last 20 minutes of the movie, which opens today at the Loews Paramount and other theaters, are full of energy, on field and in the stands. There are sloggy fumbles and splashy runs, pile-ups and mix-ups, hollers from the fans and mutters between players - one promises another ''death, humiliation and pain.'' And it's all rushing toward that big final pass. When it comes, it leaves you with the sort of sappy happy feeling that Frank Capra and Preston Sturges used to provide.

title: FEDERAL PAPER BOARD CO INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Law Is Clarified On Shoreham Drill
description: Suffolk County will not try to apply to Federal employees a law aimed at blocking a drill scheduled Feb. 13 at the Shoreham nuclear power plant, a legislator told Federal authorities in a letter delivered today.

title: CALMAT CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including pretax gains of $4,325,000 from termination of a salaried employees pension plan and $3,033,000 from the sale of the company's holdings of Statex Petroleum Incorporation for the quarter and $9,420,000 from the sale of a coal mine for the year.

title: AUCTIONS
description: ONE of the largest and most comprehensive collections of works by James Joyce, William Butler Yeats, Samuel Beckett and Henry James will be auctioned next Friday at Christie's, Park Avenue at 59th Street. The 565 books, manuscripts, typescripts, autographs and photographs were acquired from the 1930's on by James Gilvarry, a New York public-relations man who began his collection when he was attending Trinity College, Dublin.

title: Weinberger on AIDS Testing
description: Defense Secretary Caspar W. Weinberger has rejected the idea of requiring families of servicemen and Pentagon civilian employees to be tested for an antibody associated with the disease AIDS.

title: A Friendship in Deficit
description: In the 1984 Presidential election campaign, the Rev. Jesse Jackson and Senator Ernest F. Hollings became firm, if somewhat unlikely, friends and allies. Mr. Jackson was challenging the national Democratic organization with the most serious primary campaign ever brought by a black. Mr. Hollings was also seeking the Democratic nomination but making somewhat less impression on the electorate and privately counseling his fellow South Carolinian, Mr. Jackson, from time to time.

title: Oops, Right Bridge
description: To the Editor:

title: NEWMONT MINING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After charges from asset writedowns and closure costs of $56.7 million for the quarter and $58.8 million for the year. Including gains on the sale of a subsidiary of $170,000 for the quarter and $7 million for the year, a tax credit on equity in an affiliate of $462,000 for the quarter and $1,568,000 for the year and a gain from discontinued operations of $1,147,000 for the year. c-Net income including gains from discontinued operations of $940,000 for the quarter and $1,264,000 for the year and a tax credit on equity in an affiliate of $3,811,000 for the quarter and year. The year-ago figures were restated to reflect Atlantic Cement Co. as a discontinued operation.

title: Failure Rate Reported Down in Dallas Schools
description: The state's ''no-pass, no-play'' rule has barred nearly a quarter of Dallas's students from extracurricular activities for the third time this school year, but officials say the failure rate of students is down slightly.

title: AMERICAN SAVINGS & LOANS ASSN (MIAMI,FLA)(N) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary credit of $11,218,000 from the termination of the company's defined benefit pension plan and a tax credit of $1,970,000. c-Including an extraordinary credit of $1,094,000 from a special dividend of Federal Home Loan Mortgage Corporation preferred stock.

title: Profits Scoreboard
description: See accompanying notes for special items. (Loss) * Loss in year-earlier period

title: FILM: 6 WOMEN IN 'STRIPPER'
description: ''STRIPPER,'' which opens today at the Plaza, describes itself as a ''semi-documentary,'' being about the first annual Strippers Convention in Las Vegas in 1983 and about some of the women who competed.

title: AN INQUIRY ON 3 PRIVATE CLUBS WEIGHS BIAS AGAINST WOMEN
description: City officials have begun an investigation of three private clubs in Manhattan that they say discriminate against women, Mayor Koch announced yesterday.

title: ILC TECHNOLOGY reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
U.S. ACTS TO REDUCE AID TO HAITI, CHARGING HUMAN RIGHTS ABUSES
description: The State Department has decided to cut back aid to Haiti because of human rights abuses, department officials said today.

title: QUEBECOR INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
LAFARGE CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net losses. Results for the latest periods reflect a change in pension accounting.

title: UNION TEXAS PETROLEUM reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
ART: 'STUART DAVIS'S NEW YORK,' 80 PAINTINGS AND DRAWINGS
description: THE first thing to be said about ''Stuart Davis's New York'' is that it is a model of initiative and determination. Bruce Weber, the curator of collections at the Norton Gallery of Art in West Palm Beach, Fla. - where the show opened last October - tracked down around 80 paintings and drawings, some rarely seen, in order to provide a stylistic and thematic foundation for the Norton Gallery's ''New York Mural,'' a large and ambitious work painted by Davis in 1932. By including paintings done as early as 1912 and as late as 1960, four years before the artist's death, the exhibition also sets out to place the mural in the context of Davis's sustained artistic dialogue with New York City.

title: OCEAN DRILLING & EXPLORATION CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-After losses from discontinued operations of $36,838,000 for the quarter and $36,155,000 for the year and, for the quarter and year, an after-tax insurance gain of $45.2 million and a charge of $8.7 million from retirement of three barges.

title: U.S. in the U.N. Vetoes An Anti-Israeli Move
description: The United States today vetoed a Security Council resolution that said Israeli acts had ''violated the sanctity of Haram al-Sharif,'' the mosque complex on Jerusalem's Temple Mount.

title: DONNELLEY, R R & SONS reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
CHANGES EXPECTED IN NASA'S BUDGET
description: Federal budget officials said today that the explosion of the space shuttle Challenger would probably lead to profound changes in the budget of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration for at least several years.

title: ADAC LABORATORIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 29
description: b-Net income including an extraordinary gain of $54,000.

title: CHRIS WASHBURN LEARNS MUCH FROM SCRUTINY
description: After an evening spent jostling with Chris Washburn, the North Carolina State sophomore, John Salley of Georgia Tech admitted that he was very tired. ''Washburn's as good as I thought he would be,'' Salley said. Washburn scored 18 points in a losing effort Wednesday night, employing a variety of tactics, from 12-foot jump shots to a resounding dunk after he picked up a loose ball in his own backcourt and outraced the defense to the other basket.

title: FILES SHOW EX-CITY OFFICIALS STEERED DEAL TO 2 CONCERNS
description: Ousted officials of the Parking Violations Bureau steered a city towing project to two collection companies that received several hundred thousand dollars in commissions while doing virtually no work, according to city records.

title: Archbishop in Cuba Asks Florida to Spare Killer
description: The Roman Catholic Archbishop of Havana pleaded without success with Gov. Bob Graham on Wednesday to stop next week's scheduled execution of a Cuban refugee convicted of killing a man in a burglary.

title: POUGHKEEPSIE SAVINGS BANK FSB(o) reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Net loss. Year-ago figures include an extraordinary gain of $212,000. Per share results are not available due to stock conversion and issuance of 3,918,518 common shares on Nov. 20, 1985.

title: ST PAUL COMPANIES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including a $3.3 million gain from discontinued operations for the quarter and year and including net realized gains on the sale of investments of $12,779,000 for the quarter and $48,838,000 for the year. c-Net loss. d-After a net realized loss of $10,090,000 for the quarter and a loss of $18 million from discontinued operations for the year and including net realized gains of $3,944,000 for the year.

title: Advertising; Met Home Magazine To Change
description: TO know Steve Burzon of Metropolitan Home magazine is to know one of the most enthusiastic publishers in an enthusiastic business. And a full-page ad on the back of this Business Day section on Monday will disclose the cause of his current heightened verve.

title: THE SCREEN: NOSTALGIA IN 'GOODBYE PEOPLE'
description: HERB GARDNER, who wrote and directed ''The Goodbye People,'' almost certainly feels more affection for its characters than any audience will. From the film's very first moments, its three principals are bathed in a much too appreciative glow. As the film opens, they are brought together by a series of cute coincidences on the beach at Coney Island, just before sunrise. The air may be still, but things are terrifically windy all the same.

title: Advertising; Advertising Programs Grow 17% in Colleges
description: The number of colleges and universities offering valid programs in advertising grew 17 percent last year, to 103 from 88, while the number of faculty increased 10.5 percent, to 388 from 351. The latter will certainly keep the former booming even if the job market isn't.

title: State's Tax Amnesty Concludes Saturday
description: New York State's tax amnesty program ends Saturday, and officials reported today that they had so far collected $158 million from 81,000 delinquent taxpayers.

title: UNITED WATER RESOURCES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
BRYNNER'S FRIENDS REMINISCE AT ACTOR'S MEMORIAL SERVICE
description: Friends of Yul Brynner fondly remembered his life, offstage and on, at a memorial service yesterday at the Shubert Theater.

title: REAGAN URGES CONSERVATIVES TO UNITE AND PRESS AGENDA
description: President Reagan urged conservatives tonight to press ahead with their agenda of domestic and foreign policy issues, saying ''the tide of history is all but irreversibily turned our way.'' But he warned that conservatives could face a ''costly tactical defeat'' in this year's Congressional elections unless they pull together.

title: WESTCHESTER FINANCIAL SERVCES reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Advertising; Ogilvy Group's Income Rises 22.2% in Quarter
description: The Ogilvy Group yesterday released its fourth-quarter earnings, which its chief executive, William E. Phillips, characterized as ''satisfactory'' while noting that they included a number of one-time gains and special provisions.

title: BINGHAMTON SAVINGS BANK reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: b-Including an extraordinary credit of $365,000. c-Net losses including an extraordinary credit of $267,000 for the quarter and year. The company did not report per share results for the latest year because it went public in September, 1985.

title: CITIZENS BANKING CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
Could Be Worse
description: Coach Matt Guokas, after his Philadelphia 76ers had been blown out at Utah, 107-86: ''That's as bad as we can play, hopefully.''

title: Boat Classes: Hint of Summer
description: Among the signs that summer is not so far away are the boating skills and safety courses being offered in the metropolitan area.

title: APOGEE ROBOTICS INC reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
HANZLIK LEADS NUGGETS OVER KNICKS
description: The images that the Denver Nuggets bring to mind are of players who are sleek and swift. Alex English, the high-scoring forward, epitomizes that group. Bill Hanzlik does not.

title: COMMUNITY PSYCHIATRIC CENTER INC reports earnings for Qtr to Nov 30
SOUTHERN CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
GIVENCHY'S ELEGANCE CLOSES PARIS SHOW ON A HIGH NOTE
description: With a collection that was lively, fresh and supremely elegant, Hubert de Givenchy put the final exclamation point on what is generally considered an excellent couture season here. In the spring and summer showings, the couture has found its metier, which involves no strange or outlandish clothes but emphasizes beautiful designs. Totally within the couture tradition, Givenchy managed nevertheless to stretch its boundaries a bit. His clothes are both youthful and glamorous.

title: POLICE SERGEANT IS CONVICTED IN FATAL HIT-AND-RUN
description: A New York City police sergeant was convicted yesterday of manslaughter for driving a patrol car in a hit-and-run accident in which a pedestrian was killed and another was seriously injured.

title: Drew Opposes Ban
description: There's a big difference between a $500,000-a-year position in the National Basketball Association and a $500-a-week job in the Continental Basketball Association. John Drew, who has had both, prefers the N.B.A. The former N.B.A. star, who was banned by the league last week after his third bout with cocaine addiction, has been playing this season with the Wyoming Wildcatters of the C.B.A., but after sampling the long bus rides to road games, he has begun to long for the N.B.A. He said he might go to court to overturn the N.B.A. ban, which was based on a collective bargaining agreement authorizing at least a two-season suspension for a player who succumbs to addiction three times.

title: Sort of Slimmer
description: While on the subject of weight loss, consider Tab Thacker, who's positively wasting away.

title: Market Place; How 2 Funds Outdid Index
description: TOP-PERFORMING equity managers at banks used vastly different investment strategies last year in handily beating the 31.7 percent total return - market appreciation plus dividends reinvested - shown by Standard & Poor's 500-stock index.

title: SIMILAR STADIUMS AND DIFFERENT COSTS REFLECT BUILDING CLIMATE IN NEW YORK
description: On a cleared site 12 miles north of Miami, the owner of the Miami Dolphins football team is building a 73,000-seat stadium for about $100 million.

title: EDITORS' NOTE
description: A Paris dispatch in Business Day on Jan. 20 reported that Britain and France were expected to approve a rail tunnel under the English Channel, rather than a rail-and-road tunnel that had also been proposed.

title: Key Rates
description: * Municipal Bond Index, The Bond Buyer Salomon Brothers estimates for bellwether issues

title: SCREEN: 'JOEY,' ROCK TALE
description: WATCHING ''Joey,'' which opens today at the Eighth Street Playhouse, is a good way to feel old in a hurry, since it's a generation-gap movie in which both father and son are rock-and-rollers. Dad is Joey King Sr. (James Quinn), who was part of a successful singing group in the 50's and now pumps gas and drinks beer. Meanwhile, Joey Jr. (Neill Barry) has started a rock band with his teen-age friends and finds his father rather quaint until Joey Sr. petulantly takes away his son's guitar.

title: Regulations Are Needed for Truck Safety
description: To the Editor:

title: EL PASO ELECTRIC CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
MARKET WEAKENS ON PROFIT TAKING
description: The stock market's five-day winning streak came to an end yesterday as investors took profits in blue-chip and transportation issues, but continued to buy some secondary stocks during a mixed and moderately active session.

title: ANDREA RADIO CORP reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
U.S. HISPANIC POPULATION FASTEST-GROWING SECTOR
description: The Hispanic population of the United States is growing nearly five times faster than the general public, with one of every 14 Americans now of Spanish background, a new Census Bureau study discloses.

title: HEILIG-MEYERS CO reports earnings for Qtr to Dec 31
description: Share earnings reflect a 3-for-2 stock split to be paid in March 1986.

title: A $2.05 SUBWAY TOKEN? MAYBE IN '93, PANEL SAYS
description: A gubernatorial panel said yesterday that the price of a subway token would rise to $1.20 next year, $1.65 in 1990 and $2.05 in 1993 if new sources of transit financing were not found.

title: Article 578186 -- No Title
description: The Cigna Corporation, the nation's second-largest publicly held insurance company, announced yesterday that it would take a $1.2 billion charge against fourth-quarter earnings to strengthen its property and casualty reserves.

title: Jarryd Suffers Upset
description: Brad Gilbert upset fifth-seeded Anders Jarryd of Sweden 7-6, 6-0 today to advance to the quarterfinals of the $465,000 United States Pro Indoor Tennis Championships.
